boldValue Boolean false  If true then the value is displayed in bold text when read-only. 
clearEnabled Boolean true  Whether the user should be allowed to clear the selected value. If "true", an icon will be available which, when clicked, will clear the widget. This attribute is ignored if freeInputEnabled is not set to "true". 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from the picker popup before it is written to the model value of this widget. The picked value is available as the special symbol "PickedValue"

formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
freeInputEnabled Boolean true  If true, the user may enter a free-text value. 
helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode.

numEntriesPerColumn Integer 0  The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
onPick Statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the picker popup has been used to pick a value. The picked value is available as the special symbol "PickedValue" 
outputConversion Expression (String)   A Gosu expression that converts the model value to a presentation value. The model value is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". The return type of this expression must be String. 
pickLocation Statement   The picker popup used to pick a value, as a Gosu statement of the form "[popup name].push(...)". 
requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user

DomainAxis top
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
dateFormat DateTimeType   The format of the "day/month/year" portion of the date. Options are "short", "medium", and "long". If a date format is specified and a time format is not, only the date will be shown. 
label Expression (String)   An expression for the label of this axis 
lowerBound Expression (java.lang.Double)   The lower bound expression for a manual axis range. Assumes autoRange=false 
lowerMargin Expression (java.lang.Double)   A decimal value indicating the lowerMargin (or right margin, depending on which axis). This is the distance from the beginning of the axis to the first object. 
timeFormat DateTimeType   The format of the "hour/minute/AMorPM" portion of the date. Options are "short", "medium", and "long". If a time format is specified and a date format is not, only the time will be shown. 
type AxisType    
upperBound Expression (java.lang.Double)   The upper bound expression for a manual axis range. Assumes autoRange=false 
useWholeNumbers Boolean false  A Boolean where, if true, the tick values will only be display as whole numbers 
Download top
Value: Description:
true Download using the configured default disposition, inline or attachment 
false Do not download 
attachment Download as an attachment 
inline Download as an inline view 
DualAxisDataSeries top
A SecondaryDataSeries element ...
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
autoRange Boolean true  Boolean to indicate if this axis is auto-range. Default is true 
axisLabel Expression (String)   The expression for the label of the second axis. 
categoryLabel Expression (Object)   An expression which evaluates to the label of each category, as well as the name of the general category bucket in which to place this series entry. Should evaluate to the same Object as the other DataSeries elements defined previously 
dataValueType Type reference   The type of the elements in the collection defined by dataValues 
dataValues Expression (Object)   The expression for the values of this data. Must be an array, list, or query 
lowerBound Expression (java.lang.Double)   The lower bound expression for a manual axis range. Assumes autoRange=false 
rgb String   An optional Hex RGB value, e.g., "FF00FF". If specifed, it overwrites the default color for this data series. Only applicable when this data series is rendered with a single color. 
seriesLabel Expression (String)   An expression for the label of the data series 
type ChartType   The type of secondary data series graph to draw 
upperBound Expression (java.lang.Double)   The upper bound expression for a manual axis range. Assumes autoRange=false 
useWholeNumbers Boolean false  A Boolean where, if true, the tick values will only be display as whole numbers 
value Expression (Object)   An expression that maps the series value in component type of the values. The component object is accessable via the values symbol, i.e. value.getFoo(). The returned value must be a number or date. 
EditButtons top
A set of pre-included toolbar buttons for edit control. Includes edit, update, & cancel.
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
cancelDefault Boolean false  If true, the Cancel button will be the default button which can be invoked by Enter key. 
cancelLabel Expression (String)   Alternative label for the cancel button 
cancelShortcut String L  Keyboard shortcut character for cancel button, in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
cancelVisible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression specifying whether the cancel button is visible. By default the cancel button is visible when in edit mode. 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
editDefault Boolean false  If true, the Edit button will be the default button which can be invoked by Enter key. 
editLabel Expression (String)   Alternative label for the edit button 
editShortcut String E  Keyboard shortcut character for edit button, in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
editVisible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression specifying whether the edit button is visible. By default the edit button is visible when not in edit mode. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
pickValue Expression (context-dependent)   The value returned from this location when update is clicked 
showUpdateConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean) true  Gosu expression which determines whether or not the confirmation message should be shown 
updateConfirmMessage Expression (String)   Confirmation message to show when update is clicked 
updateDefault Boolean false  If true, the Update button will be the default button which can be invoked by Enter key. 
updateLabel Expression (String)   Alternative label for the update button 
updateShortcut String U  Keyboard shortcut character for update button, in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
updateVisible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression specifying whether the update button is visible. By default the update button is visible when in edit mode. 
EmptyCell top
An empty cell without a value, generally used to provide proper column alignment in heterogeneous list views
Child elements: Reflect ColumnFooter
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
align WidgetAlignment   Specifies the alignment of this cell. Valid values: "left", "right", or "center". If no value is specified, the default alignment is determined by the value type ("center" for boolean values; "right" for numeric values; "left" for other value types). 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
bold Boolean false  If true, renders the cell contents in bold text. Defaults to false. 
colspan Integer 1  Like the HTML colspan attribute, lets this cell span across multiple columns of other rows. Useful for generating a "group header" row above a RowIterator. The default value is 1. A value greater than 1 is only allowed when the containing row is not iterated by a RowIterator. 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
flex Integer   Specifies that the associated column should be given some portion of additional space when there's additional space available for a table. The extra space is allocated based on relative flex values of cells, so if this is the only Cell and the flex is set to 1, it will receive all additional space. If this Cell is set to 2 and another Cell is set to 1, this Cell will receive 2/3 of any leftover space. Setting this value will generally interfere with manual column resizing in the UI. 
footerLabel Expression (String)   An optional expression. If specified, a footer cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing Row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerSumValue" is specified. 
footerSumFormat Expression (String)   An optional expression, if specified, will be used as format pattern for the footer sum value. Normally not specified, so that the "format" and\or "formatType" of the cell value will be applied to footer sum value. Only applicable when "footerSumValue" is specified. The result of this expression must conform to the number format defined in java.text.DecimalFormat. 
footerSumValue Expression (Object)   An optional Numeric expression. If specified, a footer cell that sums the specified value for all cells in this column will be rendered. Pagination of the list does not affect the sum value. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerLabel" is specified. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
icon Expression (String)   Refers to an image file. If defined, makes this an icon cell. The "value" attribute should be a boolean expression describing whether the icon is visible in a given row. 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
label Expression (Object)   An optional expression. If specified, a header cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. 
printWidth String 1  Relative width when printing to PDF. All widths are relative to the widths of the other columns in the ListView 
showHeaderIcon Boolean true  If true, shows the icon defined by "icon" in the header cell for this column. The default value is true. 
tooltip Expression (String)   Extra "alt" text to show when the user hovers the mouse over the header cell of this column. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
width String   The HTML width of the cell in pixels. 
wrap Boolean false  If true, allows text content to wrap. Defaults to false. Warning: Setting wrap to true for cells is discouraged, as it might cause content to be truncated in list views. 
wrapLabel Boolean false  DO NOT USE. List view columns can now be resized by the user, and wrapping the header label could cause height changes as users resize. Thus, this will be removed in the next release. 
EntryPoint top
Maps from a URI that the browser can enter to a starting Location
Child elements: EntryPointParameter
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
authenticationRequired Boolean true  If true, the user must be logged in to enter through this point. If the user is not already logged in, a login page will appear before the entry point's location (unless some kind of automatic authentication occurs). Be very careful about setting this to false. 
clearSession Boolean false  If true, clears the user's server session when they enter this entry point 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to this element. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" or PCF editor, the description will show up there. 
failurePage Location reference   Normally not specified, and a default error page with detailed error messages will be displayed when for some reason the EntryPoint could not navigate to the target Location. If a page ID is specified, that page will be displayed instead of the default error page in case of error. No runtime error message will be passed to the custom page, and only static content of that page will be displayed. 
id String   ID of this EntryPoint. Must be unique among all EntryPoints. 
location Location reference   The ID of the Page, Forward, or Wizard to go to upon navigating to this EntryPoint. Note that if you want the entry point to do some complex logic, it's best to use a Forward. 
EntryPointParameter top
An HTTP parameter that gets mapped to a Location parameter
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
conversionExpression Expression (Object)   Gosu expression used to convert a URL parameter to the value passed to the location Parameter 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the entry point param. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
locationParam String   The name of the argument on the target location's entry point that this parameter will set 
optional Boolean false  If true, the parameter does not need to be specified 
type Type reference   The type to cast the incoming parameter into, such as "String" or "Integer" 
urlParam String   The parameter passed in through the URL; for example if the param is Activity and the entry point URI is ActivityDetail, you would pass Activity 3 as ActivityDetail.do?Activity=3 
ExitPoint top
Special Location for leaving the UI and redirecting somewhere else.
Child elements: LocationEntryPoint ExitPointParameter
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
height Integer 0  Height of the popup window, if popup=true 
id String   ID of this ExitPoint. Must be unique among all ExitPoints. 
logout Boolean false  If true, logs the user out of the application when they go through the ExitPoint 
method HttpMethod   HTTP method to use for this ExitPoint. If omitted, defaults to GET 
popup Boolean false  If true, opens the exit URL in a new window instead of the current one 
target String   An optional name of the popup window. Only applicable when "popup" is true. If not specified, a new window will be opened each time this exit point is invoked. 
url String   The URL to redirect the user to, such as "http://www.guidewire.com" 
width Integer 0  Width of the popup window, if popup=true 
ExitPointParameter top
An parameter to the exit point that is mapped to a URL parameter. The exact opposite of EntryPointParameter.
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
defaultValue String   The default value to use if no symbol has been provided for this param (assuming required=false; otherwise an exception will be thrown). A Gosu Expression 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the exit point param. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
locationParam String   The name of the parameter. Any link to the exit point must have a symbol defined with name equal to locationParam and of type "type" (unless required="false"). 
type Type reference   The type of symbol that must be passed as "locationParam" 
urlParam String   Param name as appears in the url. If not specified assumed to be the same as "locationParam" 
ExposeIterator top
Specifies that an iterator of a given name and type is exposed by the parent widget. This iterator can be accessed by other widgets in other pcf pages.
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
applicable Boolean true  Indicates if the widget is actually applicable in the current context. This is provided for modal panels that do not expose all of the widgets that are available in its sibling modes. 
flags Flag names   A comma separated list of the flags for the iterator 
name String   The symbol to expose the widget as. If the widget is defined on this page, this value will default to the widget name. If the widget is in a ref, this value will default to the name exposed by the ref. 
valueType Type reference   The valueType of the widget symbol, such as "String" or "Policy" 
widget Iterator name   The name of the iterator 
Expose top
Specifies that a symbol of a given name is exposed by the parent widget. This widget can be accessed by other widgets in other pcf pages.
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
applicable Boolean true  Indicates if the widget is actually applicable in the current context. This is provided for modal panels that do not expose all of the widgets that are available in its sibling modes. 
name String   The symbol to expose the widget as. If the widget is defined on this page, this value will default to the widget name. If the widget is in a ref, this value will default to the name exposed by the ref. 
widget Widget id   The name of widget 
ExposeRowTree top
Specifies that a row tree of a given name and type is exposed by the parent widget. This rowTree can be accessed by other widgets in other pcf pages.
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
applicable Boolean true  Indicates if the widget is actually applicable in the current context. This is provided for modal panels that do not expose all of the widgets that are available in its sibling modes. 
flags Flag names   A comma separated list of the flags for the row tree 
name String   The symbol to expose the widget as. If the widget is defined on this page, this value will default to the widget name. If the widget is in a ref, this value will default to the name exposed by the ref. 
valueType Type reference   The content type of the row tree, such as "String" or "Policy". This value is required if the rowtree has checkboxes. 
widget Iterator name   The name of the row tree 
FileCell top
A cell for selecting files
Child elements: Reflect ColumnFooter PostOnChange StandardMenuElement
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action Statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for details. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
align WidgetAlignment   Specifies the alignment of this cell. Valid values: "left", "right", or "center". If no value is specified, the default alignment is determined by the value type ("center" for boolean values; "right" for numeric values; "left" for other value types). 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
bold Boolean false  If true, renders the cell contents in bold text. Defaults to false. 
buttonText Expression (String) DisplayKey.get("Web.Document.FileValue.Browse")  The text displayed in the file input button 
colspan Integer 1  Like the HTML colspan attribute, lets this cell span across multiple columns of other rows. Useful for generating a "group header" row above a RowIterator. The default value is 1. A value greater than 1 is only allowed when the containing row is not iterated by a RowIterator. 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
dropzoneWidgets Widget ids   A comma separated list of widgets that are drag and drop zones for this file input. 
editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
enableSort Boolean true  If true, allows the user to sort the values in the column by clicking on the header. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. 
endOfCellNav Boolean false  If true, this cell will the last cell in the row to be navigated to via the ENTER key. Only applicable when "CellNavOnEnter" or "QuickAddOnEnter" is set. Normally not specified. Default to false. 
flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
flex Integer   Specifies that the associated column should be given some portion of additional space when there's additional space available for a table. The extra space is allocated based on relative flex values of cells, so if this is the only Cell and the flex is set to 1, it will receive all additional space. If this Cell is set to 2 and another Cell is set to 1, this Cell will receive 2/3 of any leftover space. Setting this value will generally interfere with manual column resizing in the UI. 
focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
fontColor Expression (String)   An expression that returns a String containing the CSS color to be used for highlighting a column. If the expression returns null or "", no highlighting is done. If the expression returns "Normal", normal highlighting will be used. 
footerLabel Expression (String)   An optional expression. If specified, a footer cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing Row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerSumValue" is specified. 
footerSumFormat Expression (String)   An optional expression, if specified, will be used as format pattern for the footer sum value. Normally not specified, so that the "format" and\or "formatType" of the cell value will be applied to footer sum value. Only applicable when "footerSumValue" is specified. The result of this expression must conform to the number format defined in java.text.DecimalFormat. 
footerSumValue Expression (Object)   An optional Numeric expression. If specified, a footer cell that sums the specified value for all cells in this column will be rendered. Pagination of the list does not affect the sum value. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerLabel" is specified. 
formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
groupedOnEnter Expression (Boolean)   If true, the ListView will be grouped by this cell upon entering the page. Only one grouped cell is allowed at any given time and it is only applicable when the column is sortable. 
hasCheckBox Boolean false  If true, generates a checkbox at the beginning of this cell. This checkbox can be used to check this entry in the nearest containing Iterator. Defaults to false. Only allowed if this cell is inside a CellIterator or under a Row inside a RowIterator. 
helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
icon Expression (String)   Refers to an image file. If defined, makes this an icon cell. The "value" attribute should be a boolean expression describing whether the icon is visible in a given row. 
iconLabel Expression (String)   The ALT text for any icon generated in the content cells 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
inputConversion Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that converts the presentation value to a model value. The presentation value string is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". 
label Expression (Object)   An optional expression. If specified, a header cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. 
labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the header. 
multiple Boolean false  If set to true, the file input may be used to select multiple files 
numCols Expression (java.lang.Integer)   Integer expression specifying the width of the input text in characters (please note that this value is approximate for variable width fonts). This attribute is deprecated; use the width attribute on the cell instead. 
numEntriesPerColumn Integer 0  The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
onPick Statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
outputConversion Expression (String)   A Gosu expression that converts the model value to a presentation value. The model value is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". The return type of this expression must be String. 
printWidth String 1  Relative width when printing to PDF. All widths are relative to the widths of the other columns in the ListView 
requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
setter Statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
showHeaderIcon Boolean true  If true, shows the icon defined by "icon" in the header cell for this column. The default value is true. 
sortBy String   An optional comma-separated sequence of Expressions, each of which is assumed to be a dot-delimited path, the value by which this column will be sorted if the user clicks on the header cell. 
sortDirection WidgetSortDirection ascending  Either "ascending" or "descending" 
sortOrder Integer 0  The priority of sorting relative to other sorting elements like IteratorSort and Cell. The lower the number, the higher the priority. The highest priority is "1" 
styleClass WidgetStyleClass   CSS style class for the cell content; for instance, "miniButton" makes a link appear as a small button 
subMenuOnDemand Boolean false  An optional attribute, if set, defer sub menu generation until user tries to open the menu. DO NOT set this flag unless the sub menu of this widget is very expensive to generate. Setting this flag will reduce time to load the page, however require fetching additional info from server in the background, when the menu gets opened for the first time after page loaded. 
tooltip Expression (String)   Extra "alt" text to show when the user hovers the mouse over the header cell of this column. 
unique Boolean false  If true, validate before commit that the value of this column is unique across all rows in the current page. Only meaningful when this column is editable. 
validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
validationLabel Expression (String)   The label of this cell to be used when it has validation issues. Not needed when this cell has a "label". Required if the cell is editable but does not have a "label". 
value Expression (context-dependent)   The value this element binds to. If the element is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
valueDisplayed Expression (Boolean) true  If set to true, the name(s) of the selected file(s) is/are displayed next to the file input button 
valueVisible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, hides the contents of the cell (its "ValueWidget"), but not the cell itself. Needed since hiding the actual cell usually screws up the layout 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
width String   The HTML width of the cell in pixels. 
wrap Boolean false  If true, allows text content to wrap. Defaults to false. Warning: Setting wrap to true for cells is discouraged, as it might cause content to be truncated in list views. 
wrapLabel Boolean false  DO NOT USE. List view columns can now be resized by the user, and wrapping the header label could cause height changes as users resize. Thus, this will be removed in the next release. 
FileInput top
An input for selecting files
Child elements: LayoutConfig Reflect StandardMenuElement PostOnChange
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action Statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for list of available action prefixes. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
align WidgetAlignment   Alignment of the widget ("left", "right", or "center") 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
boldLabel Boolean false  If true then the label is displayed in bold text. 
boldValue Boolean false  If true then the value is displayed in bold text when read-only. 
buttonText Expression (String) DisplayKey.get("Web.Document.FileValue.Browse")  The text displayed in the file input button 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
dropzoneWidgets Widget ids   A comma separated list of widgets that are drag and drop zones for this file input. 
editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
inputConversion Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that converts the presentation value to a model value. The presentation value string is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". 
label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
labelAbove Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if true, causes the label portion of the Input to be rendered above the value 
labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the label. 
multiple Boolean false  If set to true, the file input may be used to select multiple files 
numCols Expression (java.lang.Integer)   Integer expression specifying the width of the input text in characters (please note that this value is approximate for variable width fonts). 
numEntriesPerColumn Integer 0  The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
onPick Statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
outputConversion Expression (String)   A Gosu expression that converts the model value to a presentation value. The model value is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". The return type of this expression must be String. 
requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
setter Statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
shortcut String   Optional keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. This is only applicable when this widget has an "action" specified and the value is not being edited. 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
subMenuOnDemand Boolean false  An optional attribute, if set, defer sub menu generation until user tries to open the menu. DO NOT set this flag unless the sub menu of this widget is very expensive to generate. Setting this flag will reduce time to load the page, however require fetching additional info from server in the background, when the menu gets opened for the first time after page loaded. 
validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
value Expression (context-dependent)   The value this Input binds to as an Expression. If the Input is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
valueDisplayed Expression (Boolean) true  If set to true, the name(s) of the selected file(s) is/are displayed next to the file input button 
valueWidgetType String Text  The type of value widget to create for this input, such as Text or TypeKey. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   If used instead of "editable", specifies whether the Input is editable when data is being created 
FinancialCriterionChoiceInput top
ClaimCenter-specific PCF elements.
Child elements: LayoutConfig Reflect StandardMenuElement PostOnChange
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action Statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for list of available action prefixes. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
align WidgetAlignment   Alignment of the widget ("left", "right", or "center") 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
boldLabel Boolean false  If true then the label is displayed in bold text. 
boldValue Boolean false  If true then the value is displayed in bold text when read-only. 
chosenOptionVisible Boolean false   
confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
inputConversion Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that converts the presentation value to a model value. The presentation value string is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". 
label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
labelAbove Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if true, causes the label portion of the Input to be rendered above the value 
labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the label. 
numCols Expression (java.lang.Integer)   Integer expression specifying the width of the input text in characters (please note that this value is approximate for variable width fonts). 
numEntriesPerColumn Integer 0  The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
onPick Statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
outputConversion Expression (String)   A Gosu expression that converts the model value to a presentation value. The model value is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". The return type of this expression must be String. 
requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
setter Statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
shortcut String   Optional keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. This is only applicable when this widget has an "action" specified and the value is not being edited. 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
subMenuOnDemand Boolean false  An optional attribute, if set, defer sub menu generation until user tries to open the menu. DO NOT set this flag unless the sub menu of this widget is very expensive to generate. Setting this flag will reduce time to load the page, however require fetching additional info from server in the background, when the menu gets opened for the first time after page loaded. 
validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
value Expression (context-dependent)   The value this Input binds to as an Expression. If the Input is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
valueType Type reference   The type of the value expression. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   If used instead of "editable", specifies whether the Input is editable when data is being created 
FinancialCriterionMultiCurrencyChoiceInput top
ClaimCenter-specific PCF elements.
Child elements: LayoutConfig Reflect StandardMenuElement PostOnChange
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action Statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for list of available action prefixes. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
align WidgetAlignment   Alignment of the widget ("left", "right", or "center") 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
boldLabel Boolean false  If true then the label is displayed in bold text. 
boldValue Boolean false  If true then the value is displayed in bold text when read-only. 
chosenOptionVisible Boolean false   
confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
inputConversion Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that converts the presentation value to a model value. The presentation value string is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". 
label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
labelAbove Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if true, causes the label portion of the Input to be rendered above the value 
labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the label. 
numCols Expression (java.lang.Integer)   Integer expression specifying the width of the input text in characters (please note that this value is approximate for variable width fonts). 
numEntriesPerColumn Integer 0  The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
onPick Statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
outputConversion Expression (String)   A Gosu expression that converts the model value to a presentation value. The model value is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". The return type of this expression must be String. 
requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
setter Statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
shortcut String   Optional keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. This is only applicable when this widget has an "action" specified and the value is not being edited. 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
subMenuOnDemand Boolean false  An optional attribute, if set, defer sub menu generation until user tries to open the menu. DO NOT set this flag unless the sub menu of this widget is very expensive to generate. Setting this flag will reduce time to load the page, however require fetching additional info from server in the background, when the menu gets opened for the first time after page loaded. 
validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
value Expression (context-dependent)   The value this Input binds to as an Expression. If the Input is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
valueType Type reference entity.FinancialCriterionMC  The type of the value expression. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   If used instead of "editable", specifies whether the Input is editable when data is being created 
FormatCell top
A ListView cell that renders its children in a single column.
Child elements: Reflect ColumnFooter TextInput ContentInput InputIterator
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
align WidgetAlignment   Specifies the alignment of this cell. Valid values: "left", "right", or "center". If no value is specified, the default alignment is determined by the value type ("center" for boolean values; "right" for numeric values; "left" for other value types). 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
bold Boolean false  If true, renders the cell contents in bold text. Defaults to false. 
colspan Integer 1  Like the HTML colspan attribute, lets this cell span across multiple columns of other rows. Useful for generating a "group header" row above a RowIterator. The default value is 1. A value greater than 1 is only allowed when the containing row is not iterated by a RowIterator. 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
flex Integer   Specifies that the associated column should be given some portion of additional space when there's additional space available for a table. The extra space is allocated based on relative flex values of cells, so if this is the only Cell and the flex is set to 1, it will receive all additional space. If this Cell is set to 2 and another Cell is set to 1, this Cell will receive 2/3 of any leftover space. Setting this value will generally interfere with manual column resizing in the UI. 
footerLabel Expression (String)   An optional expression. If specified, a footer cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing Row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerSumValue" is specified. 
footerSumFormat Expression (String)   An optional expression, if specified, will be used as format pattern for the footer sum value. Normally not specified, so that the "format" and\or "formatType" of the cell value will be applied to footer sum value. Only applicable when "footerSumValue" is specified. The result of this expression must conform to the number format defined in java.text.DecimalFormat. 
footerSumValue Expression (Object)   An optional Numeric expression. If specified, a footer cell that sums the specified value for all cells in this column will be rendered. Pagination of the list does not affect the sum value. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerLabel" is specified. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
icon Expression (String)   Refers to an image file. If defined, makes this an icon cell. The "value" attribute should be a boolean expression describing whether the icon is visible in a given row. 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
label Expression (Object)   An optional expression. If specified, a header cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. 
printWidth String 1  Relative width when printing to PDF. All widths are relative to the widths of the other columns in the ListView 
showHeaderIcon Boolean true  If true, shows the icon defined by "icon" in the header cell for this column. The default value is true. 
sortBy String   An optional comma-separated sequence of Expressions, each of which is assumed to be a dot-delimited path, the value by which this column will be sorted if the user clicks on the header cell. 
sortDirection WidgetSortDirection ascending  Either "ascending" or "descending" 
sortOrder Integer 0  The priority of sorting relative to other sorting elements like IteratorSort and Cell. The lower the number, the higher the priority. The highest priority is "1" 
tooltip Expression (String)   Extra "alt" text to show when the user hovers the mouse over the header cell of this column. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
width String   The HTML width of the cell in pixels. 
wrap Boolean false  If true, allows text content to wrap. Defaults to false. Warning: Setting wrap to true for cells is discouraged, as it might cause content to be truncated in list views. 
wrapLabel Boolean false  DO NOT USE. List view columns can now be resized by the user, and wrapping the header label could cause height changes as users resize. Thus, this will be removed in the next release. 
FormatType top
Input format types
Value: Description:
general No special formatting applied 
currency Formatted to look like an amount of money 
email Formatted to look like an email address, including a "mailto:" link 
percentagePoints Formatted to look like a percentage 
exactNumber Formatted as a number with full precision (no rounding) 
phoneNumber Formatted as a phone number 
ForwardCondition top
Forwards to a location if the given condition is satisfied
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action Statement   The action that is performed when the Forward is entered, if "condition" evaluates to true. See ActionBase for details. 
condition Expression (Boolean) true  A Gosu expression evaluating to a Boolean. The first ForwardCondition which evalutes to true has its action run 
Forward top
A Location that automatically redirects to some other Location
Child elements: LocationEntryPoint Variable ForwardCondition Code
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action Statement   The action that is performed when the Forward is entered. See ActionBase for details. 
canVisit Expression (Boolean)   A boolean expression which, if false, means the user has no permission to visit the location, and links to the location will be either invisible or grayed out, depending on context. 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to this element. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" or PCF editor, the description will show up there. 
id String   ID of this Location. Must be unique among all Locations. 
onBeforeForward Statement   An expression that will be executed prior to the forward. 
parent Location reference   Reference to the "parent location" of this location, to specifiy the hierarchy of pcf locations. Used for the automatically generated "up link" in the title bar, highlighting of current menu links, and grouping items under "Unsaved Work". Usually the parent is the location right above this location in the application hierarchy, i.e. the parent of "ActivityDetailWorksheet" is "ClaimWorkplan", the parent of "Desktop Activities" is "Desktop" and "Desktop" has no parent at all. 
GroupCell top
A Cell that includes a drop-down list of groups, and a menu containing Select Group and Search Group items. The locations to which those items navigate are specified by the searchLocation and selectionLocation attributes.
Child elements: Reflect ColumnFooter PostOnChange StandardMenuElement
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action Statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for details. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
align WidgetAlignment   Specifies the alignment of this cell. Valid values: "left", "right", or "center". If no value is specified, the default alignment is determined by the value type ("center" for boolean values; "right" for numeric values; "left" for other value types). 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
bold Boolean false  If true, renders the cell contents in bold text. Defaults to false. 
colspan Integer 1  Like the HTML colspan attribute, lets this cell span across multiple columns of other rows. Useful for generating a "group header" row above a RowIterator. The default value is 1. A value greater than 1 is only allowed when the containing row is not iterated by a RowIterator. 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
enableSort Boolean true  If true, allows the user to sort the values in the column by clicking on the header. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. 
endOfCellNav Boolean false  If true, this cell will the last cell in the row to be navigated to via the ENTER key. Only applicable when "CellNavOnEnter" or "QuickAddOnEnter" is set. Normally not specified. Default to false. 
flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
flex Integer   Specifies that the associated column should be given some portion of additional space when there's additional space available for a table. The extra space is allocated based on relative flex values of cells, so if this is the only Cell and the flex is set to 1, it will receive all additional space. If this Cell is set to 2 and another Cell is set to 1, this Cell will receive 2/3 of any leftover space. Setting this value will generally interfere with manual column resizing in the UI. 
focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
fontColor Expression (String)   An expression that returns a String containing the CSS color to be used for highlighting a column. If the expression returns null or "", no highlighting is done. If the expression returns "Normal", normal highlighting will be used. 
footerLabel Expression (String)   An optional expression. If specified, a footer cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing Row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerSumValue" is specified. 
footerSumFormat Expression (String)   An optional expression, if specified, will be used as format pattern for the footer sum value. Normally not specified, so that the "format" and\or "formatType" of the cell value will be applied to footer sum value. Only applicable when "footerSumValue" is specified. The result of this expression must conform to the number format defined in java.text.DecimalFormat. 
footerSumValue Expression (Object)   An optional Numeric expression. If specified, a footer cell that sums the specified value for all cells in this column will be rendered. Pagination of the list does not affect the sum value. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerLabel" is specified. 
formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
groupedOnEnter Expression (Boolean)   If true, the ListView will be grouped by this cell upon entering the page. Only one grouped cell is allowed at any given time and it is only applicable when the column is sortable. 
hasCheckBox Boolean false  If true, generates a checkbox at the beginning of this cell. This checkbox can be used to check this entry in the nearest containing Iterator. Defaults to false. Only allowed if this cell is inside a CellIterator or under a Row inside a RowIterator. 
helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
icon Expression (String)   Refers to an image file. If defined, makes this an icon cell. The "value" attribute should be a boolean expression describing whether the icon is visible in a given row. 
iconLabel Expression (String)   The ALT text for any icon generated in the content cells 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
inputConversion Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that converts the presentation value to a model value. The presentation value string is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". 
label Expression (Object)   An optional expression. If specified, a header cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. 
labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the header. 
numCols Expression (java.lang.Integer)   Integer expression specifying the width of the input text in characters (please note that this value is approximate for variable width fonts). This attribute is deprecated; use the width attribute on the cell instead. 
numEntriesPerColumn Integer 0  The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
onPick Statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
outputConversion Expression (String)   A Gosu expression that converts the model value to a presentation value. The model value is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". The return type of this expression must be String. 
printWidth String 1  Relative width when printing to PDF. All widths are relative to the widths of the other columns in the ListView 
requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
searchLocation Expression (pcf.api.Location) pcf.GroupSearchPopup.push()  The location of the group search item as a Gosu expression of the form "[location name].push()" 
selectLocation Expression (pcf.api.Location) pcf.OrganizationGroupTreePopup.push()  The location of the group select items as a Gosu expression of the form "[location name].push()" 
setter Statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
showHeaderIcon Boolean true  If true, shows the icon defined by "icon" in the header cell for this column. The default value is true. 
sortBy String   An optional comma-separated sequence of Expressions, each of which is assumed to be a dot-delimited path, the value by which this column will be sorted if the user clicks on the header cell. 
sortDirection WidgetSortDirection ascending  Either "ascending" or "descending" 
sortOrder Integer 0  The priority of sorting relative to other sorting elements like IteratorSort and Cell. The lower the number, the higher the priority. The highest priority is "1" 
styleClass WidgetStyleClass   CSS style class for the cell content; for instance, "miniButton" makes a link appear as a small button 
subMenuOnDemand Boolean false  An optional attribute, if set, defer sub menu generation until user tries to open the menu. DO NOT set this flag unless the sub menu of this widget is very expensive to generate. Setting this flag will reduce time to load the page, however require fetching additional info from server in the background, when the menu gets opened for the first time after page loaded. 
tooltip Expression (String)   Extra "alt" text to show when the user hovers the mouse over the header cell of this column. 
unique Boolean false  If true, validate before commit that the value of this column is unique across all rows in the current page. Only meaningful when this column is editable. 
validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
validationLabel Expression (String)   The label of this cell to be used when it has validation issues. Not needed when this cell has a "label". Required if the cell is editable but does not have a "label". 
value Expression (context-dependent)   The value this element binds to. If the element is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
valueRange Expression (Object) gw.api.admin.BaseAdminUtil.getGroupsForCurrentUser()  A list of possible values as a Gosu 
valueType Type reference entity.Group  The type of the value expression. 
valueVisible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, hides the contents of the cell (its "ValueWidget"), but not the cell itself. Needed since hiding the actual cell usually screws up the layout 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
width String   The HTML width of the cell in pixels. 
wrap Boolean false  If true, allows text content to wrap. Defaults to false. Warning: Setting wrap to true for cells is discouraged, as it might cause content to be truncated in list views. 
wrapLabel Boolean false  DO NOT USE. List view columns can now be resized by the user, and wrapping the header label could cause height changes as users resize. Thus, this will be removed in the next release. 
GroupInput top
An Input that includes a drop-down list of groups, and a menu containing Select Group and Search Group items. The locations to which those items navigate are specified by the searchLocation and selectionLocation attributes.
Child elements: LayoutConfig Reflect StandardMenuElement PostOnChange
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action Statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for list of available action prefixes. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
align WidgetAlignment   Alignment of the widget ("left", "right", or "center") 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
boldLabel Boolean false  If true then the label is displayed in bold text. 
boldValue Boolean false  If true then the value is displayed in bold text when read-only. 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration.
