helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
inputConversion Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that converts the presentation value to a model value. The presentation value string is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". 
label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
labelAbove Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if true, causes the label portion of the Input to be rendered above the value 
labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the label. 
numCols Expression (java.lang.Integer)   Integer expression specifying the width of the input text in characters (please note that this value is approximate for variable width fonts). 
numEntriesPerColumn Integer 0  The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
onPick Statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
outputConversion Expression (String)   A Gosu expression that converts the model value to a presentation value. The model value is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". The return type of this expression must be String. 
requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
searchLocation Expression (pcf.api.Location) pcf.GroupSearchPopup.push()  The location of the group search item as a Gosu expression of the form "[location name].push()" 
selectLocation Expression (pcf.api.Location) pcf.OrganizationGroupTreePopup.push()  The location of the group select items as a Gosu expression of the form "[location name].push()" 
setter Statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
shortcut String   Optional keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. This is only applicable when this widget has an "action" specified and the value is not being edited. 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
subMenuOnDemand Boolean false  An optional attribute, if set, defer sub menu generation until user tries to open the menu. DO NOT set this flag unless the sub menu of this widget is very expensive to generate. Setting this flag will reduce time to load the page, however require fetching additional info from server in the background, when the menu gets opened for the first time after page loaded. 
validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
value Expression (context-dependent)   The value this Input binds to as an Expression. If the Input is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
valueRange Expression (Object) gw.api.admin.BaseAdminUtil.getGroupsForCurrentUser()  A list of possible values as a Gosu 
valueType Type reference entity.Group  The type of the value expression. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   If used instead of "editable", specifies whether the Input is editable when data is being created 
HiddenInput top
An input which is present client-side but never displayed to nor editable by the user. Consider using a Variable instead if the value doesn't need to be present on the client.
Child elements: LayoutConfig Reflect StandardMenuElement PostOnChange
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action Statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for list of available action prefixes. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
align WidgetAlignment   Alignment of the widget ("left", "right", or "center") 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
boldLabel Boolean false  If true then the label is displayed in bold text. 
boldValue Boolean false  If true then the value is displayed in bold text when read-only. 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary.

If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus.

Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected.

HiddenLink top
An invisible link that can only be invoked by JavaScript or a keyboard shortcut
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action Statement   Action performed by this widget. By default, this is a Gosu expression. Other types of actions can be specified by using the following prefixes: http: causes the browser to follow the specified plain http link https: causes the browser to follow the specified plain https link javascript: causes the browser to execute the specified javascript logout: logs out of the application 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children and makes them unclickable 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   Confirmation message to show before performing the action 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
download Download   Should be 'true', 'inline' or 'attachment' if the action taken by this widget is to download a file. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
promptDefault Expression (String)   Default text answer to the prompt message 
promptQuestion Expression (String)   Question to ask the user before performing the action. The answser is exposed to the action as "web.WebUtil.ActionEventParameter". 
shortcut String   Keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean) true  Gosu expression which determines whether or not the confirmation message should be shown 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children

hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable.

nullString String   String to be displayed if the value is null. Defaults to an empty string. 
tooltip Expression (String)   Tooltip for this widget 
value Expression (Object)   The value of the element, displayed in bold. 
valueIcons Expression (Object)   An optional reference to one or multiple image files. If specified, the image(s) will be displayed in front of the value.

A single line just below the TabBar for displaying arbitrary page info

hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable.

mode String   An optional String which, if specified, means that any element dynamically including this widget must specify the same mode. There is also a special mode "default" you can use which means "Use this widget if no widget with the specified mode exists". You can also have this widget match more than one mode by separating mode strings with a | character.

width String   HTML width of the column, in pixels ("30") or percent ("40%").

InputGroup top
Groups a set of Inputs together and provides a group label and allows the user show or hide content under this group.
Child elements: AbstractInput InputSet PostOnChange
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
allowToggle Expression (Boolean)   An optional Boolean expression, if returns false, the checkbox for the user to toggle visibility of child widgets will be disabled. Default to true. 
childrenVisible Expression (Boolean)   A Boolean expression which indicates if child widgets under this group are visible, and whether the checkbox is checked. The expression must be writeable, unless the "onToggle" attribute is specified. 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
icon Expression (String)   An optional icon to be displayed along the group label. 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
label Expression (Object)   Label for this group 
onToggle Statement   If specified, this expression will be executed (instead of setting "childrenVisible") when the user toggles the checkbox. The current state of the checkbox is exposed as "VALUE". Executing this expression MUST result in the value of "childrenVisible" to match the "VALUE" passed in. This attribute is normally NOT specified. 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the user checks or unchecks this group. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
InputHeaderSection top
Child elements: AbstractInput InputSet
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
labelWidth Integer   The width of input labels in pixels. Normally not specified. Experimental for new rendering framework. 
refreshOnProgressComplete Expression (Object)   Only meaningful when this widget contains a Progress widget. Specifies an entity to refresh when the Progress widget completes its operation, at which point this widget will re-render itself. 
InputIterator top
An iterator for DetailView content.
Child elements: IteratorSort AbstractInput InputSet
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
autoAdd Expression (Boolean)   An optional Boolean Gosu expression, if evaluated to true, add numEntriesToAdd elements to this iterator when entering the page, if the page is in edit mode upon enter. Normally not set, unless the iterator has less entries than required; otherwise, the user may have to manually remove unwanted entries that are automatically added. 
conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   An optional Gosu expression used to convert a picked value into a value that can be added to the iterator. The picked value is available as the special symbol "PickedValue" 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
elementName String   As each element in the array result of "value" is displayed, it is exposed as a symbol with the name "elementName", which the contents of this iterator can refer to 
forceRefreshDespiteChangedEntries Boolean false  If true, the iterator will refresh its entries even if they have changed.

This has risks. Refreshing from an IQueryBeanResult value will ignore newly added or removed entries. Changed or newly added entries may be reordered. User input that cannot be written to the underlying data (such as malformed date strings) may be lost.

Use with care. Safest on list or array iterators that contain only simple inputs such as checkboxes or dropdowns

 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
numEntriesToAdd Integer   An optional attribute, if set, overrides number of entries to add when the add button is pushed. Default to 1. Normally not set.

If set to a value greater than 1, any entry that is not modified by the user after it's added will be removed before commit the page. It's a risk of potential data loss. USE WITH CAUTION.

 
pickLocation Statement   Specifies the picker popup to use when adding new elements to the iterator, as a Gosu statement of the format "[popup name].push(...)" 
toAdd Statement   The Gosu expression that is evaluated to add a new value to the list. The value is exposed using the name specified by "elementName". An example would be "Foo.addToBars(bar)". Either toAdd or toCreateAndAdd must be defined for the user to add entries to the iterator; however you cannot define both. If the entries are not entities, toCreateAndAdd must be used instead of toAdd. 
toCreateAndAdd Expression (context-dependent)   The Gosu expression that is evaluated to create a new value and add it to the list. An example would be "Foo.addToBars(Foo.createNewBar())". Either toAdd or toCreateAndAdd must be defined for the user to add entries to the iterator; however you cannot define both. 
toRemove Statement   The Gosu expression that is evaluated to remove a value from the Iterator. The value is exposed using the name specified by "elementName". Must be defined for the user to be able to remove values from the iterator. 
type Type reference   Lets you manually specify the type of element exposed as "elementName". This is useful if you have special knowledge about the type of element returned by "value": for example, if the field referred to returns an array of Contacts but you happen to know that they are guaranteed to all be Persons 
validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
validationLabel Expression (String)   The label of this iterator to be used when it has validation issues. 
value Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression that evaluates to the elements over which to iterate. Must evaluate to an Object array or a IQueryBeanResult. 
valueType Type reference   The type of the value expression. 
InputSet top
A reusable set of Inputs
Child elements: Require Variable Expose ExposeIterator ExposeRowTree ReferencedWidget AbstractInput InputSet Code
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:

hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
mode String   An optional String which, if specified, means that any element dynamically including this widget must specify the same mode. There is also a special mode "default" you can use which means "Use this widget if no widget with the specified mode exists". You can also have this widget match more than one mode by separating mode strings with a | character. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
InputSetRef top
Includes an InputSet by reference.
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
def Shared section reference   The ID of the InputSet to include by reference. 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
editable Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
mode Expression (Object)   If defined, "mode" is evaluated and its result is converted to a String; the panel will be loaded whose "mode" matches the evaluated "mode" of this element. If no panel is found with a matching "mode", then the panel with mode="default" is used; if there is no default a runtime exception is thrown 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
widgets Widget ids   A comma separated list of widgets that are needed by the section. 
IteratorButtons top
A set of pre-included toolbar buttons for iterator control, including "add" and "remove". The "add" button lets the iterator to add new entries using its default behavior. If you want to override the default add behavior of the iterator, use <AddButton> element instead.
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
addConfirmMessage Expression (String)   Confirmation message to show before performing the add action 
addLabel Expression (String)   Alternative label for the add button 
addShortcut String A  Keyboard shortcut character for add button, in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
addVisible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression specifying whether the add button is visible. By default the add button is visible when the location is in edit mode and the Iterator has "toAdd", "toCreateAndAdd" , or "pickLocation" defined. 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean true  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
iterator Iterator reference   The id of the iterator/list view widget this button applies to. If the value is a list view then the first iterator widget child is used. 
refreshTarget String   If specified, clicking the add or remove button will do a partial-page refresh rather than a full-page refresh. The semantics are the same as for the "target" attribute on a PostOnChange node: it can either be "DATA_ONLY" or the id of a valid target. 
removeConfirmMessage Expression (String)   Confirmation message to show before performing the remove action 
removeFlags String   The flags to determine availability of the remove button. See the ToolbarButton "flags" attribute for syntax. By default, the remove button is available when at least one row in the list is checked. 
removeLabel Expression (String)   Alternative label for the remove button 
removeShortcut String R  Keyboard shortcut character for remove button, in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
removeVisible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression specifying whether the remove button is visible. By default the remove button is visible when the Iterator has "toRemove" defined. 
showAddConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean) true  Expression which determines whether or not the add confirmation message should be shown 
showRemoveConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean) true  Expression which determines whether or not the remove confirmation message should be shown 
IteratorSort top
Provides an expression used to sort the enclosing iterator
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
sortBy Expression (Object)   Gosu expression specifying the value by which the nearest Iterator will be sorted. 
sortDirection WidgetSortDirection ascending  Either "ascending" or "descending" 
sortOrder Integer   The priority of sorting relative to other sorting elements like IteratorSort and Cell. The lower the number, the higher the priority. The highest priority is "1" 
Label top
A label for marking a section of the DetailView
Child elements: LayoutConfig
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
label Expression (String)   Label to render. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides this section label 
LabelOrientation top
Value: Description:
Horizontal  
Vertical  
Down45  
Up45  
LayoutConfig top
Optional layout configuration for inputs.
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
colspan Expression (java.lang.Integer)   Gosu expression that defined the column span for the field, it only apply to table layout and the expression should evaluate to an integer 
tdClass Expression (String)   Custom CSS style classes applied to the containing cell in a Table Layout. It should evaluate to one or more style classnames. 
Layout top
Optional layout configuration for rendering content. For example table type allows rendering content into an HTML table with the total number of columns specified.If layout is not specified, child components will be rendered sequentially into the Container.
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
border Boolean false  If true, the panel will get a slight 1-pixel rectangular border around it. Purely a visual effect. 
columns Expression (java.lang.Double)   Gosu expression that defined the total number of columns to create for table layout. 
equalWidth Boolean true  If true, table will have the same width for columns.Default is true. 
type LayoutType   Layout type; options include "table". 
LayoutType top
Layout format types
Value: Description:
table Table formatting applied 
LinkCell top
A ListView cell containing arbitrary content, such as links.
Child elements: Reflect ColumnFooter AbstractLink
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
align WidgetAlignment   Specifies the alignment of this cell. Valid values: "left", "right", or "center". If no value is specified, the default alignment is determined by the value type ("center" for boolean values; "right" for numeric values; "left" for other value types). 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
bold Boolean false  If true, renders the cell contents in bold text. Defaults to false. 
colspan Integer 1  Like the HTML colspan attribute, lets this cell span across multiple columns of other rows. Useful for generating a "group header" row above a RowIterator. The default value is 1. A value greater than 1 is only allowed when the containing row is not iterated by a RowIterator. 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
flex Integer   Specifies that the associated column should be given some portion of additional space when there's additional space available for a table. The extra space is allocated based on relative flex values of cells, so if this is the only Cell and the flex is set to 1, it will receive all additional space. If this Cell is set to 2 and another Cell is set to 1, this Cell will receive 2/3 of any leftover space. Setting this value will generally interfere with manual column resizing in the UI. 
footerLabel Expression (String)   An optional expression. If specified, a footer cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing Row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerSumValue" is specified. 
footerSumFormat Expression (String)   An optional expression, if specified, will be used as format pattern for the footer sum value. Normally not specified, so that the "format" and\or "formatType" of the cell value will be applied to footer sum value. Only applicable when "footerSumValue" is specified. The result of this expression must conform to the number format defined in java.text.DecimalFormat. 
footerSumValue Expression (Object)   An optional Numeric expression. If specified, a footer cell that sums the specified value for all cells in this column will be rendered. Pagination of the list does not affect the sum value. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerLabel" is specified. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
icon Expression (String)   Refers to an image file. If defined, makes this an icon cell. The "value" attribute should be a boolean expression describing whether the icon is visible in a given row. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
label Expression (Object)   An optional expression. If specified, a header cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. 
printWidth String 1  Relative width when printing to PDF. All widths are relative to the widths of the other columns in the ListView 
showHeaderIcon Boolean true  If true, shows the icon defined by "icon" in the header cell for this column. The default value is true. 
sortBy String   An optional comma-separated sequence of Expressions, each of which is assumed to be a dot-delimited path, the value by which this column will be sorted if the user clicks on the header cell. 
sortDirection WidgetSortDirection ascending  Either "ascending" or "descending" 
sortOrder Integer 0  The priority of sorting relative to other sorting elements like IteratorSort and Cell. The lower the number, the higher the priority. The highest priority is "1" 
tooltip Expression (String)   Extra "alt" text to show when the user hovers the mouse over the header cell of this column. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
width String   The HTML width of the cell in pixels. 
wrap Boolean false  If true, allows text content to wrap. Defaults to false. Warning: Setting wrap to true for cells is discouraged, as it might cause content to be truncated in list views. 
wrapLabel Boolean false  DO NOT USE. List view columns can now be resized by the user, and wrapping the header label could cause height changes as users resize. Thus, this will be removed in the next release. 
LinkIterator top
Generates Link elements based on a list of values.
Child elements: IteratorSort AbstractLink
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
elementName String   As each element in the array result of "value" is displayed, it is exposed as a symbol with the name "elementName", which the contents of this iterator can refer to 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
type Type reference   Lets you manually specify the type of element exposed as "elementName". This is useful if you have special knowledge about the type of element returned by "value": for example, if the field referred to returns an array of Contacts but you happen to know that they are guaranteed to all be Persons 
value Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression that evaluates to the elements over which to iterate. Must evaluate to an Object array or a IQueryBeanResult. 
valueType Type reference   The type of the value expression. 
Link top
Generates a hyperlink that can perform some action when the user clicks on it
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action Statement   Action performed by this widget. By default, this is a Gosu expression. Other types of actions can be specified by using the following prefixes: http: causes the browser to follow the specified plain http link https: causes the browser to follow the specified plain https link javascript: causes the browser to execute the specified javascript logout: logs out of the application 
argInitialValue Expression (Object)   The optional initial value for the action argument. Only meaningful, when "argType" is specified. 
argLabel Expression (String)   The optional label for the action argument. Only meaningful, when "argType" is specified. 
argOptionLabel Expression (Object)   Optional Gosu expression to determine the label displayed for each element in the arg range. If not set, default to the element's string representation. The element value is exposed as "VALUE". 
argRange Expression (Object)   Gosu expression defining the range of possible arg values for this action. Should evaluate to a list that matches the "argType" 
argType String   The type of the argument for this action.If set, the widget will allow the user to enter an argument value of this type before invoke the action.Supported types: String, Number and java.util.Date.The argument value is exposed to the "action" attribute as "ArgValue". 
argWidth Positive integer   Optional pixel width for the dropdown control of the action argument. Only applicable when "argRange" is specified.Usually you get best results by leaving this unspecified. You can set this attribute when some options in the dropdown range are too long and you need to reduce the display width of the dropdown control. 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children and makes them unclickable 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   Confirmation message to show before performing the action 
default Boolean false  If true, the button is the default for the page, and will be "clicked" when the user presses Enter 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
download Download   Should be 'true', 'inline' or 'attachment' if the action taken by this widget is to download a file. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
icon Expression (String)   Optional icon to show in the link instead of a label; should be a reference to an image file 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
performActionOnArgChange Boolean false  The optional flag, if true, the action will be performed as soon as the arg value ischanged and no action button will be rendered 
promptDefault Expression (String)   Default text answer to the prompt message 
promptQuestion Expression (String)   Question to ask the user before performing the action. The answser is exposed to the action as "web.WebUtil.ActionEventParameter". 
recalculateArgOnRefresh Boolean false  The optional boolean flag, if set, the value of the action argument will be reset by calculating the argInitialValue expression, when the page is rerendered from the server. Default to false. 
retainScrollPosition Boolean false  If true, the page will scroll back to the original scroll position after the action. Should only be set if the action stays on the same page and the page layout does not change. Default to false 
shortcut String   Keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean) true  Gosu expression which determines whether or not the confirmation message should be shown 
styleClass WidgetStyleClass   CSS style class for the link; for instance, "miniButton" makes the link appear as a small button 
tooltip Expression (String)   An expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info if the user hovers the mouse over the button 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
ListDetailPanel top
A special panel for displaying a ListView, followed by a CardView whose contents can depend on the element selected in the ListView.
Child elements: Require Variable Expose ExposeIterator ExposeRowTree ReferencedWidget AbstractPanelDef AbstractPanel Code
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
lockWhileEditing Boolean false  If true, then the user won't be allowed to change the selection while the current selection is being edited. 
selectionName String   Name of the special "selection" symbol representing the selected value from the list. The card set typically refers to this symbol to show information about it. 
selectionOnEnter Expression (Object)   If this expression evaluates to anything other than null, the list-detail panel will attempt to select the result when this page is entered. Typically this will be set to a variable which is (optionally) passed in to this page. 
selectionType Type reference   Type of the selection symbol, usually the same as the type of element rendered by rows in the ListView 
ListViewInput top
Includes an entire ListView as an input, and supplies it with an optional toolbar.
Child elements: Toolbar ListViewPanel
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
boldLabel Boolean false  If true then the label is displayed in bold text 
def Shared section reference   ID of the ListView to include by reference (should only be used if you are not adding the def as a direct child of this element). 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
editable Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
label Expression (String)   Label to render. 
labelAbove Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if true, causes the label portion of the Input to be rendered above the ListView, allowing the ListView to expand left into the column of labels 
labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the label. 
mode Expression (Object)   If you are including the ListView by reference and you define a "mode" expression, then "mode" is evaluated and its result is converted to a String; the Def will be loaded whose "mode" matches the evaluated "mode" of this element. If no Def is found with a matching "mode", then the Def with mode="default" is used; if there is no default a runtime exception is thrown 
validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as error and the record will not be committed. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
widgets Widget ids   A comma separated list of widgets that are needed by the section. 
width String 100%  The HTML width of the list view input body. The default value is "100%" to align multiple sibling list view inputs. 
ListViewPanel top
A panel whose content is formatted as a two-dimensional table
Child elements: Require Variable Expose ExposeIterator ExposeRowTree ReferencedWidget AbstractRow Code
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
alternateEntryStyle Boolean true  If true, alternate style (e.g., background color) when rendering each entry within this ListView. Defaults to true. 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
editable Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
height Integer   Height of the ListView panel, in pixels. If defined, the list data can be scrolled independently from the rest of the page. THIS IS AN EXPERIMENTAL FEATURE to improve usability when the list data per page is long. USE WITH CAUTION. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
mode String   An optional String which, if specified, means that any element dynamically including this widget must specify the same mode. There is also a special mode "default" you can use which means "Use this widget if no widget with the specified mode exists". You can also have this widget match more than one mode by separating mode strings with a | character. 
validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as error and the record will not be committed. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
LocationEntryPoint top
An entry point for accessing a Location.
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
signature String   The signature of the entry point, of the form "[location name]([args])". 
LocationGroup top
A group of locations (analogous to a directory that contains multiple files). When navigate to the group directly, it automatically forwards to the first visitable child LocationRef. When no accessible child LocationRef exists in this group, navigation directly to this group is disabled. When the "canVisit" expression of this group returns false, navigation to any descendents of this group is disabled. (A Location is considered a descendent of this group, if this Location is referenced by a child LocationRef of this group or has a "parent" attribute that points to this group or a descendent of this group.)
Child elements: LocationEntryPoint Variable LocationRefIterator LocationRef Code
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
acceleratedMenuActions Shared section reference   The ID of the AcceleratedMenuActions content for this location group. It will be inherited by all descendent Locations of this group by default. Normally not used, but use MenuActions instead. 
afterEnter Statement   A Gosu expression to run after this location group is entered. Because a location group is always entered before any descendent Location in the group, this expression will be executed before any descendent Location is entered. 
beforeLeave Statement   A Gosu expression to run before leaving this location group. 
browserTitle Expression (String)   The optional browser title of the location. If specified, the value will be displayed in the browser window title when this location is being viewed in the main content area. 
canVisit Expression (Boolean)   A boolean expression which, if false, means the user has no permission to visit this location Group or any Page (or sub-LocationGroup) in this group. If omitted, this LocationGroup can be visited only if at least one of its children can be visited. 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to this element. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" or PCF editor, the description will show up there. 
id String   ID of this Location. Must be unique among all Locations. 
infoBar Shared section reference   The ID of the InfoBar content for this group. InfoBar will be inherited by all descendent Locations of this group by default. 
menuActions Shared section reference   The ID of the MenuActions content for this location group. MenuActions will be inherited by all descendent Locations of this group by default. 
menuLinks Shared section reference   Normally NOT specified, in which case default MenuLinks are generated based on all visitable child LocationRefs of this group.

MenuLinks are rendered in the left menu, if this group is not nested within another group; otherwise, they are rendered as page links next to the screen title. 

menuLinksTitle Expression (String)   An optional title for the default MenuLinks of this LocationGroup, if set, generates a title bar that can collapse and expand the MenuLinks 
menuLinksTitleIcon Expression (String)   An optional title icon for the default MenuLinks of this LocationGroup, if set, generates a title bar that can collapse and expand the MenuLinks 
menuTree Shared section reference   The ID of the MenuTree content for this location group. MenuTree will be inherited by all descendent Locations of this group by default. 
onAutoSave Statement   A Gosu expression to run when this location group is moved to the auto-save cache. 
onResume Statement   A Gosu expression to run when this location is resumed from the autosave cache. 
pageLinksRenderer String   If "PageLinksDropdown" is specified for this attribute and this location group is nested within another location group, the links to child Locations will be rendered as a dropdown. Normally not specified, so that standard page links manager will be used. "PageLinksDropdown" is the only valid value for this attribute. 
parent Location reference   Reference to the "parent location" of this location, to specifiy the hierarchy of pcf locations. Used for the automatically generated "up link" in the title bar, highlighting of current menu links, and grouping items under "Unsaved Work". Usually the parent is the location right above this location in the application hierarchy, i.e. the parent of "ActivityDetailWorksheet" is "ClaimWorkplan", the parent of "Desktop Activities" is "Desktop" and "Desktop" has no parent at all. 
tabBar Shared section reference TabBar()  ID of the TabBar content for this location group. Normally not specified since "TabBar()" is the default. 
title Expression (Object)   The title of the Location Group. When this is a root Location Group (i.e., does not belong to any parent Location), the title will be used as group title in the Unsaved-Work panel when any descendent Location has unsaved work. When this is not a root Location Group, the title may be used as the default label for the left menu item that leads to this Location Group. 
LocationRefIterator top
Creates as many copies of its content as there are components in the array referenced by "value". Supplies the component value to the created content as "elementName". Used inside a LocationGroup.
Child elements: LocationRef
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
elementName String   As each element in the array result of "value" is displayed, it is exposed as a symbol with the name "elementName", which the contents of this iterator can refer to 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
type Type reference   Lets you manually specify the type of element exposed as "elementName". This is useful if you have special knowledge about the type of element returned by "value": for example, if the field referred to returns an array of Contacts but you happen to know that they are guaranteed to all be Persons 
value Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression that evaluates to the elements over which to iterate. Must evaluate to an Object array or a IQueryBeanResult. 
valueType Type reference   The type of the value expression. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
LocationRef top
A reference to a location
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
hideIfDisabled Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression. If returns true, this widget will not be displayed when the action is disabled. Default to true. 
label Expression (String)   An optional Gosu expression the result of which is used as the label for the link to this location. Normally NOT specified, therefore allow a default label to be generated from the title of the target location. 
location Location reference   A Gosu expression pointing to the location this element refers to, of the form "[location name]([args])" 
shortcut String   Optional keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. If specifed, this will be used for default MenuLink generated for this LocationRef. 
LoginPage top
Special Page element for the login page.
Child elements: LocationEntryPoint Variable Screen ScreenRef Code
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
afterCancel Statement   Gosu expression to run after the location is canceled. 
afterCommit Statement   Gosu expression to run after the location is updated. 
afterEnter Statement   Gosu expression to run after this page is entered. 
afterReturnFromPopup Statement   Gosu expression to run after return to this page from a popup. Whether the popup was committed is exposed as a symbol with the name "committed". 
alwaysInEditMode Boolean false  If true, the location will always go back to edit mode after a commit / cancel 
autosaveable Boolean true  If true, then the location will be saved in the auto-save cache when the user navigates out if (a) it is in edit mode, and (b) there is any unsaved data. The location is restored from the cache when the user returns to it 
beforeCancel Statement   Gosu expression to run when the location is canceled but before the rest of the cancel completes. 
beforeCommit Statement   Gosu expression to run before the location is updated but after the UI is validated. 
beforeValidate Statement   Gosu expression to run before the location is updated and before the UI is validated. 
browserTitle Expression (String)   The optional browser title of the location. If specified, the value will be displayed in the browser window title when this location is being viewed in the main content area. 
canEdit Expression (Boolean)   A boolean expression which, if false, prevents the user from putting the location into edit mode 
canVisit Expression (Boolean)   A boolean expression which, if false, means the user has no permission to visit the location, and links to the location will be either invisible or grayed out, depending on context. 
countsAsWork Boolean true  If false, the location can still be kept in the autosave cache, but does not appear as unsaved work to the user (with link highlighting etc.). 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to this element. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" or PCF editor, the description will show up there. 
handlesValidationIssue Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if specified, determines whether validation issues on a particular entity should be fixed on this page. The entity instance with validation issues is exposed to this expression as "VALUE". For example, "VALUE typeis entity.MyBean". If not specified, validation issues on any entity that matches type of the "validationParameter" should be fixed on this page.
No point to specify this attribute, if "validationParameter" is not defined. 
hideLeftNavIfEmpty Boolean false  If true, the left navigation menu will be hidden when there are no menulinks 
id String   ID of this Location. Must be unique among all Locations. 
infoBar Shared section reference   ID of the InfoBar content for this location. Normally not specifed, so that the page inherits the infoBar from its ancestor LocationGroup. 
onConcurrentDataChange Statement   This expression, when specified, appends a link to the concurrent data change error message. The text of the link will be the value of the display key Java.Message.ConcurrentDataChange.Link. Clicking on the link will execute the given expression. A concurrent data change error happens if a user's changes cannot be committed because they clash with concurrent changes by a different user. 
onResume Statement   A Gosu expression to run when this location is resumed from the autosave cache. 
parent Location reference   Reference to the "parent location" of this location, to specifiy the hierarchy of pcf locations. Used for the automatically generated "up link" in the title bar, highlighting of current menu links, and grouping items under "Unsaved Work". Usually the parent is the location right above this location in the application hierarchy, i.e. the parent of "ActivityDetailWorksheet" is "ClaimWorkplan", the parent of "Desktop Activities" is "Desktop" and "Desktop" has no parent at all. 
showUpLink Boolean false  If true, creates an "up link" icon in the title bar that links to the parent location. The upLink will pop the current location off the stack if the parent location is in the stack; otherwise, the upLink will "go" to the parent location, passing all of the symbols from the current page in a manner consistent with the "go" action. 
startEditing Statement   Gosu expression to run when the location goes into edit mode. 
startInEditMode Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if true, puts the location in edit mode as soon as the user enters it 
title Expression (Object)   The title of the location. The title is shown in the top title bar, unless the Screen uses a special TitleBar element to override it. 
validateOnBundleCommit Boolean true  If false, the page will disable the automatic validation that happens on every commit. Only set this attribute to false if you're really sure you know what you're doing. 
validationParameter String   The name of an argument on a LocationEntryPoint, used for fixing entity validation issues. 
LoginSubmitButton top
Child elements: LayoutConfig StandardMenuElement
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action Statement   The action to invoke when this button is clicked by the user. 
align WidgetAlignment   Alignment of the widget ("left", "right", or "center") 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
boldLabel Boolean false  If true then the label is displayed in bold text. 
boldValue Boolean false  If true then the value is displayed in bold text when read-only. 
default Boolean false  If true, the button is the default for the page, and will be "clicked" when the user presses Enter 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
download Download   Should be 'true', 'inline' or 'attachment' if the action taken by this widget is to download a file. 
flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, this button will not be shown in read-only mode if it has child MenuItems but no action. 
hideIfDisabled Expression (Boolean) true  If set to true, this widget will not be displayed when the action is disabled. Default to true. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
labelAbove Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if true, causes the label portion of the Input to be rendered above the value 
labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the label. 
numEntriesPerColumn Integer 0  The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
shortcut String   Keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
value Expression (Object)   The value to be displayed on the button. 
valueType Type reference java.lang.String  The type of the value expression. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   If used instead of "editable", specifies whether the Input is editable when data is being created 
MenuActions top
An element containing all "action links" in the left menu bar
Child elements: Require Variable StandardMenuElement Code
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
mode String   An optional String which, if specified, means that any element dynamically including this widget must specify the same mode. There is also a special mode "default" you can use which means "Use this widget if no widget with the specified mode exists". You can also have this widget match more than one mode by separating mode strings with a | character. 
numEntriesPerColumn Integer 0  The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
subMenuOnDemand Boolean false  An optional attribute, if set, defer sub menu generation until user tries to open the menu. DO NOT set this flag unless the sub menu of this widget is very expensive to generate. Setting this flag will reduce time to load the page, however require fetching additional info from server in the background, when the menu gets opened for the first time after page loaded. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
MenuItemDivider top
Simple divider between a set of menu items. Only works when used for "menu links" in the left menu bar.
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
MenuItemIterator top
Creates as many copies of its MenuItem content as there are components in the array referenced by "value". Supplies the component value to the created content as "elementName". Used inside a hierarchical menu.
Child elements: IteratorSort StandardMenuElement
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
elementName String   As each element in the array result of "value" is displayed, it is exposed as a symbol with the name "elementName", which the contents of this iterator can refer to 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
type Type reference   Lets you manually specify the type of element exposed as "elementName". This is useful if you have special knowledge about the type of element returned by "value": for example, if the field referred to returns an array of Contacts but you happen to know that they are guaranteed to all be Persons 
value Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression that evaluates to the elements over which to iterate. Must evaluate to an Object array or a IQueryBeanResult. 
valueType Type reference   The type of the value expression. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
MenuItem top
An action item in a hierarchical menu
Child elements: StandardMenuElement
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action Statement   Action performed by this widget. By default, this is a Gosu expression. Other types of actions can be specified by using the following prefixes: http: causes the browser to follow the specified plain http link https: causes the browser to follow the specified plain https link javascript: causes the browser to execute the specified javascript logout: logs out of the application 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children and makes them unclickable 
checked Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression. If true, this item will not be displayed as checked. Default to false. 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   Confirmation message to show before performing the action 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
download Download   Should be 'true', 'inline' or 'attachment' if the action taken by this widget is to download a file. 
hideIfDisabled Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression. If returns true, this widget will not be displayed when the action is disabled. Default to true. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
icon Expression (String)   If this menu item is the only menu item belonging to an input or cell, it is rendered as the icon specified by this attribute. 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
promptDefault Expression (String)   Default text answer to the prompt message 
promptQuestion Expression (String)   Question to ask the user before performing the action. The answser is exposed to the action as "web.WebUtil.ActionEventParameter". 
retainScrollPosition Boolean false  If true, the page will scroll back to the original scroll position after the action. Should only be set if the action stays on the same page and the page layout does not change. Default to false 
shortcut String   Keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean) true  Gosu expression which determines whether or not the confirmation message should be shown 
subMenuOnDemand Boolean false  An optional attribute, if set, defer sub menu generation until user tries to open the menu. Do not set this flag if this is an immediate child item under a flattened menu, because child items are still unknown at the time they need to be flattened onto the parent menu. DO NOT set this flag unless the sub menu of this widget is very expensive to generate. Setting this flag will reduce time to load the page, however require fetching additional info from server in the background, when the menu gets opened for the first time after page loaded. 
tooltip Expression (String)   An expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info if the user hovers the mouse over the button 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
MenuItemSet top
A reusable set of MenuItems.
Child elements: Require Variable StandardMenuElement Code
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
mode String   An optional String which, if specified, means that any element dynamically including this widget must specify the same mode. There is also a special mode "default" you can use which means "Use this widget if no widget with the specified mode exists". You can also have this widget match more than one mode by separating mode strings with a | character. 
MenuItemSetRef top
Includes a MenuItemSet by reference.
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
def Shared section reference   The ID of the MenuItemSet to include by reference. 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
mode Expression (Object)   If defined, "mode" is evaluated and its result is converted to a String; the panel will be loaded whose "mode" matches the evaluated "mode" of this element. If no panel is found with a matching "mode", then the panel with mode="default" is used; if there is no default a runtime exception is thrown 
MenuItemTree top
Creates as many copies of its MenuItem content as there are components in the array referenced by "value". Supplies the component value to the created content as "elementName". Used inside a hierarchical menu.
Child elements: MenuItem
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
children Expression (Object)   Gosu expression that takes an item and evaluates it to 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
disableActionForNonLeafNodes Boolean true  Whether or not to disable the action for non-leaf nodes. By default this is true, meaning that non-leaf nodes will not have an action listener. 
elementName String   As each element in the array result of "value" is displayed, it is exposed as a symbol with the name "elementName", which the contents of this iterator can refer to 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
type Type reference   Lets you manually specify the type of element exposed as "elementName". This is useful if you have special knowledge about the type of element returned by "value": for example, if the field referred to returns an array of Contacts but you happen to know that they are guaranteed to all be Persons 
value Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression that evaluates to the elements over which to iterate. Must evaluate to an Object array or a IQueryBeanResult. 
valueType Type reference   The type of the value expression. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
MenuLinks top
An element containing all "menu links" in the left menu bar
Child elements: Require Variable StandardMenuElement Code
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
mode String   An optional String which, if specified, means that any element dynamically including this widget must specify the same mode. There is also a special mode "default" you can use which means "Use this widget if no widget with the specified mode exists". You can also have this widget match more than one mode by separating mode strings with a | character. 
MenuTree top
Like MenuLinks, but supplies a TreeView instead of regular links
Child elements: Require Variable AbstractTreeView
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
height String   Height of the tree panel, in pixels 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
Messages top
A widget that displays runtime web messages in the UI. If a Screen does not contain a child Messages element explicitly, all messages of the containing location will be rendered at the beginning of the Screen. The only time you want to add this widget into a PCF is when you need to change where messages are displayed for a particular Screen.
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
groupScope Boolean false  This widget displays all messages from the containing Location by default. If "useScope" is set to true, this widget will display messages from the current Location Group instead. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
MetricLimitValueCell top
Cell for editing a metric limit value, which may be one of several types (integer, decimal, percent or currency)
Child elements: Reflect ColumnFooter PostOnChange StandardMenuElement
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action Statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for details. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
align WidgetAlignment   Specifies the alignment of this cell. Valid values: "left", "right", or "center". If no value is specified, the default alignment is determined by the value type ("center" for boolean values; "right" for numeric values; "left" for other value types). 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
bold Boolean false  If true, renders the cell contents in bold text. Defaults to false. 
colspan Integer 1  Like the HTML colspan attribute, lets this cell span across multiple columns of other rows. Useful for generating a "group header" row above a RowIterator. The default value is 1. A value greater than 1 is only allowed when the containing row is not iterated by a RowIterator. 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
enableSort Boolean true  If true, allows the user to sort the values in the column by clicking on the header. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. 
endOfCellNav Boolean false  If true, this cell will the last cell in the row to be navigated to via the ENTER key. Only applicable when "CellNavOnEnter" or "QuickAddOnEnter" is set. Normally not specified. Default to false. 
flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
flex Integer   Specifies that the associated column should be given some portion of additional space when there's additional space available for a table. The extra space is allocated based on relative flex values of cells, so if this is the only Cell and the flex is set to 1, it will receive all additional space. If this Cell is set to 2 and another Cell is set to 1, this Cell will receive 2/3 of any leftover space. Setting this value will generally interfere with manual column resizing in the UI. 
focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
fontColor Expression (String)   An expression that returns a String containing the CSS color to be used for highlighting a column. If the expression returns null or "", no highlighting is done. If the expression returns "Normal", normal highlighting will be used. 
footerLabel Expression (String)   An optional expression. If specified, a footer cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing Row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerSumValue" is specified. 
footerSumFormat Expression (String)   An optional expression, if specified, will be used as format pattern for the footer sum value. Normally not specified, so that the "format" and\or "formatType" of the cell value will be applied to footer sum value. Only applicable when "footerSumValue" is specified. The result of this expression must conform to the number format defined in java.text.DecimalFormat. 
footerSumValue Expression (Object)   An optional Numeric expression. If specified, a footer cell that sums the specified value for all cells in this column will be rendered. Pagination of the list does not affect the sum value. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerLabel" is specified. 
formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
groupedOnEnter Expression (Boolean)   If true, the ListView will be grouped by this cell upon entering the page. Only one grouped cell is allowed at any given time and it is only applicable when the column is sortable. 
hasCheckBox Boolean false  If true, generates a checkbox at the beginning of this cell. This checkbox can be used to check this entry in the nearest containing Iterator. Defaults to false. Only allowed if this cell is inside a CellIterator or under a Row inside a RowIterator. 
helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable.
