    showHeaderIcon Boolean true  If true, shows the icon defined by "icon" in the header cell for this column. The default value is true. 
    sortBy String   An optional comma-separated sequence of Expressions, each of which is assumed to be a dot-delimited path, the value by which this column will be sorted if the user clicks on the header cell. 
    sortDirection WidgetSortDirection ascending  Either "ascending" or "descending" 
    sortOrder Integer 0  The priority of sorting relative to other sorting elements like IteratorSort and Cell. The lower the number, the higher the priority. The highest priority is "1" 
    sortValueRange Boolean true  If true, attempts to sort the results of valueRange 
    styleClass WidgetStyleClass   CSS style class for the cell content; for instance, "miniButton" makes a link appear as a small button 
    subMenuOnDemand Boolean false  An optional attribute, if set, defer sub menu generation until user tries to open the menu. DO NOT set this flag unless the sub menu of this widget is very expensive to generate. Setting this flag will reduce time to load the page, however require fetching additional info from server in the background, when the menu gets opened for the first time after page loaded. 
    tooltip Expression (String)   Extra "alt" text to show when the user hovers the mouse over the header cell of this column. 
    unique Boolean false  If true, validate before commit that the value of this column is unique across all rows in the current page. Only meaningful when this column is editable. 
    validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
    validationLabel Expression (String)   The label of this cell to be used when it has validation issues. Not needed when this cell has a "label". Required if the cell is editable but does not have a "label". 
    value Expression (context-dependent)   The value this element binds to. If the element is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
    valueRange Expression (Object)   Gosu expression defining the range of possible values for this element. Should evaluate to a List, an array, or a IQueryBeanResult 
    valueType Type reference   The type of the value expression. 
    valueVisible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, hides the contents of the cell (its "ValueWidget"), but not the cell itself. Needed since hiding the actual cell usually screws up the layout 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
    width String   The HTML width of the cell in pixels. 
    wrap Boolean false  If true, allows text content to wrap. Defaults to false. Warning: Setting wrap to true for cells is discouraged, as it might cause content to be truncated in list views. 
    wrapLabel Boolean false  DO NOT USE. List view columns can now be resized by the user, and wrapping the header label could cause height changes as users resize. Thus, this will be removed in the next release. 
    RangeCellType top
    Base type for all ListView cells bound to a value which is restricted by a value range
    Subclasses: AssigneeCell RangeCell RangeRadioCell
    RangeInput top
    An input bound to a value which is limited by a range
    Child elements: LayoutConfig Reflect StandardMenuElement PostOnChange
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    action Statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for list of available action prefixes. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
    actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
    align WidgetAlignment   Alignment of the widget ("left", "right", or "center") 
    available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
    boldLabel Boolean false  If true then the label is displayed in bold text. 
    boldValue Boolean false  If true then the value is displayed in bold text when read-only. 
    confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
    conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
    filter Expression (context-dependent)   Optional Gosu expression for filtering the value range of the widget. You can write this either as a boolean expression over a "VALUE" symbol (i.e. "Libraries.MyLib.isOkValue(VALUE)"), or as a more complex expression that takes a "VALUES" array symbol and returns a List (i.e. "Libraries.MyLib.filterValues(VALUES)") which is more powerful and efficient but harder to write. 
    flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
    focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
    formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
    helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
    hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
    inputConversion Expression (Object)    
    label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
    labelAbove Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if true, causes the label portion of the Input to be rendered above the value 
    labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the label. 
    multiSelect Boolean false  Indicates that this input is a multiselect. If true, the value expression should refer to an array. 
    newLabel Expression (String) DisplayKey.get("Java.NameValueView.New")  Label expression for the "New..." option. The default label defined for the application will be used if this attribute is not specified. 
    newValue Expression (Object)   Value expression that returns a new instance for the input value. The "New..." option will be available when this attribute is specifed. 
    noneSelectedLabel Expression (String) DisplayKey.get("Java.NameValueView.NoneSelected")  Label expression for the "none selected" option 
    numCols Expression (java.lang.Integer)   Integer expression specifying the width of the input text in characters (please note that this value is approximate for variable width fonts). 
    numEntriesPerColumn Integer 0  The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
    numRows Integer   The number of rows to show in a multi-select input. This attribute is invalid on a single-select input. 
    onPick Statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
    optionGroupLabel Expression (String)   Optional Gosu expression, if specified, the options will be displayed in groups based on its group label. Defaults to null. The element value is exposed as "VALUE". 
    optionLabel Expression (String)   Optional Gosu expression used to determine the label displayed for each element of the value range. Defaults to the element's display name or string representation if not present. The element value is exposed as "VALUE". 
    requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
    required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
    setter Statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
    shortcut String   Optional keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. This is only applicable when this widget has an "action" specified and the value is not being edited. 
    showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
    shuttleList Boolean false  If true, the input will be rendered as a "shuttle" input, allowing the user to select options by moving them from one list to another. 
    sortValueRange Boolean true  If true, attempts to sort the results of valueRange 
    subMenuOnDemand Boolean false  An optional attribute, if set, defer sub menu generation until user tries to open the menu. DO NOT set this flag unless the sub menu of this widget is very expensive to generate. Setting this flag will reduce time to load the page, however require fetching additional info from server in the background, when the menu gets opened for the first time after page loaded. 
    validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
    value Expression (context-dependent)   The value this Input binds to as an Expression. If the Input is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
    valueRange Expression (Object)   Gosu expression defining the range of possible values for this element. Should evaluate to a List, an array, or a IQueryBeanResult 
    valueType Type reference   The type of the value expression. 
    valueWidth Expression (java.lang.Integer)   Optional integer expression specifying the pixel width for the dropdown control inside the cell. Usually you get best results by leaving this unspecified. You can set this attribute when some options of this dropdown are too long and you need to reduce the display width of the dropdown control. 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   If used instead of "editable", specifies whether the Input is editable when data is being created 
    RangeRadioCell top
    A RangeCell which renders as radio buttons. Only use this when you know that the range of values is limited to two or three options.
    Child elements: Reflect ColumnFooter PostOnChange StandardMenuElement
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    action Statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for details. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
    actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
    align WidgetAlignment   Specifies the alignment of this cell. Valid values: "left", "right", or "center". If no value is specified, the default alignment is determined by the value type ("center" for boolean values; "right" for numeric values; "left" for other value types). 
    available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
    bold Boolean false  If true, renders the cell contents in bold text. Defaults to false. 
    colspan Integer 1  Like the HTML colspan attribute, lets this cell span across multiple columns of other rows. Useful for generating a "group header" row above a RowIterator. The default value is 1. A value greater than 1 is only allowed when the containing row is not iterated by a RowIterator. 
    confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
    conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
    enableSort Boolean true  If true, allows the user to sort the values in the column by clicking on the header. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. 
    endOfCellNav Boolean false  If true, this cell will the last cell in the row to be navigated to via the ENTER key. Only applicable when "CellNavOnEnter" or "QuickAddOnEnter" is set. Normally not specified. Default to false. 
    filter Expression (context-dependent)   Optional Gosu expression for filtering the value range of the widget. You can write this either as a boolean expression over a "VALUE" symbol (i.e. "Libraries.MyLib.isOkValue(VALUE)"), or as a more complex expression that takes a "VALUES" array symbol and returns a List (i.e. "Libraries.MyLib.filterValues(VALUES)") which is more powerful and efficient but harder to write. 
    flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
    flex Integer   Specifies that the associated column should be given some portion of additional space when there's additional space available for a table. The extra space is allocated based on relative flex values of cells, so if this is the only Cell and the flex is set to 1, it will receive all additional space. If this Cell is set to 2 and another Cell is set to 1, this Cell will receive 2/3 of any leftover space. Setting this value will generally interfere with manual column resizing in the UI. 
    focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
    fontColor Expression (String)   An expression that returns a String containing the CSS color to be used for highlighting a column. If the expression returns null or "", no highlighting is done. If the expression returns "Normal", normal highlighting will be used. 
    footerLabel Expression (String)   An optional expression. If specified, a footer cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing Row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerSumValue" is specified. 
    footerSumFormat Expression (String)   An optional expression, if specified, will be used as format pattern for the footer sum value. Normally not specified, so that the "format" and\or "formatType" of the cell value will be applied to footer sum value. Only applicable when "footerSumValue" is specified. The result of this expression must conform to the number format defined in java.text.DecimalFormat. 
    footerSumValue Expression (Object)   An optional Numeric expression. If specified, a footer cell that sums the specified value for all cells in this column will be rendered. Pagination of the list does not affect the sum value. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerLabel" is specified. 
    formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
    groupedOnEnter Expression (Boolean)   If true, the ListView will be grouped by this cell upon entering the page. Only one grouped cell is allowed at any given time and it is only applicable when the column is sortable. 
    hasCheckBox Boolean false  If true, generates a checkbox at the beginning of this cell. This checkbox can be used to check this entry in the nearest containing Iterator. Defaults to false. Only allowed if this cell is inside a CellIterator or under a Row inside a RowIterator. 
    helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
    hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    icon Expression (String)   Refers to an image file. If defined, makes this an icon cell. The "value" attribute should be a boolean expression describing whether the icon is visible in a given row. 
    iconLabel Expression (String)   The ALT text for any icon generated in the content cells 
    id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
    inputConversion Expression (Object)    
    label Expression (Object)   An optional expression. If specified, a header cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. 
    labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the header. 
    newLabel Expression (String) DisplayKey.get("Java.NameValueView.New")  Label expression for the "New..." option. The default label defined for the application will be used if this attribute is not specified. 
    newValue Expression (Object)   Value expression that returns a new instance for the input value. The "New..." option will be available when this attribute is specifed. 
    noneSelectedLabel Expression (String) DisplayKey.get("Java.NameValueView.NoneSelected")  Label expression for the "none selected" option 
    numCols Expression (java.lang.Integer)   Integer expression specifying the width of the input text in characters (please note that this value is approximate for variable width fonts). This attribute is deprecated; use the width attribute on the cell instead. 
    numEntriesPerColumn Integer 0  The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
    onPick Statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
    optionLabel Expression (String)   Optional Gosu expression used to determine the label displayed for each element of the value range. Defaults to the element's display name or string representation if not present. The element value is exposed as "VALUE". 
    printWidth String 1  Relative width when printing to PDF. All widths are relative to the widths of the other columns in the ListView 
    requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
    required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
    setter Statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
    showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
    showHeaderIcon Boolean true  If true, shows the icon defined by "icon" in the header cell for this column. The default value is true. 
    sortBy String   An optional comma-separated sequence of Expressions, each of which is assumed to be a dot-delimited path, the value by which this column will be sorted if the user clicks on the header cell. 
    sortDirection WidgetSortDirection ascending  Either "ascending" or "descending" 
    sortOrder Integer 0  The priority of sorting relative to other sorting elements like IteratorSort and Cell. The lower the number, the higher the priority. The highest priority is "1" 
    sortValueRange Boolean true  If true, attempts to sort the results of valueRange 
    styleClass WidgetStyleClass   CSS style class for the cell content; for instance, "miniButton" makes a link appear as a small button 
    subMenuOnDemand Boolean false  An optional attribute, if set, defer sub menu generation until user tries to open the menu. DO NOT set this flag unless the sub menu of this widget is very expensive to generate. Setting this flag will reduce time to load the page, however require fetching additional info from server in the background, when the menu gets opened for the first time after page loaded. 
    tooltip Expression (String)   Extra "alt" text to show when the user hovers the mouse over the header cell of this column. 
    unique Boolean false  If true, validate before commit that the value of this column is unique across all rows in the current page. Only meaningful when this column is editable. 
    validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
    validationLabel Expression (String)   The label of this cell to be used when it has validation issues. Not needed when this cell has a "label". Required if the cell is editable but does not have a "label". 
    value Expression (context-dependent)   The value this element binds to. If the element is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
    valueRange Expression (Object)   Gosu expression defining the range of possible values for this element. Should evaluate to a List, an array, or a IQueryBeanResult 
    valueType Type reference   The type of the value expression. 
    valueVisible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, hides the contents of the cell (its "ValueWidget"), but not the cell itself. Needed since hiding the actual cell usually screws up the layout 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
    width String   The HTML width of the cell in pixels. 
    wrap Boolean false  If true, allows text content to wrap. Defaults to false. Warning: Setting wrap to true for cells is discouraged, as it might cause content to be truncated in list views. 
    wrapLabel Boolean false  DO NOT USE. List view columns can now be resized by the user, and wrapping the header label could cause height changes as users resize. Thus, this will be removed in the next release. 
    RangeRadioInput top
    A RangeInput which renders as radio buttons. Only use this when you know that the range of values is limited to two or three options.
    Child elements: LayoutConfig Reflect StandardMenuElement PostOnChange
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    action Statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for list of available action prefixes. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
    actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode.     filter Expression (context-dependent)   Optional Gosu expression for filtering the value range of the widget. You can write this either as a boolean expression over a "VALUE" symbol (i.e. "Libraries.MyLib.isOkValue(VALUE)"), or as a more complex expression that takes a "VALUES" array symbol and returns a List (i.e. "Libraries.MyLib.filterValues(VALUES)") which is more powerful and efficient but harder to write.

    focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
    formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
    helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
    hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
    inputConversion Expression (Object)    
    label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
    labelAbove Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if true, causes the label portion of the Input to be rendered above the value 
    labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the label. 
    newLabel Expression (String) DisplayKey.get("Java.NameValueView.New")  Label expression for the "New..." option. The default label defined for the application will be used if this attribute is not specified. 
    newValue Expression (Object)   Value expression that returns a new instance for the input value. The "New..." option will be available when this attribute is specifed. 
    noneSelectedLabel Expression (String) DisplayKey.get("Java.NameValueView.NoneSelected")  Label expression for the "none selected" option 
    numCols Expression (java.lang.Integer)   Integer expression specifying the width of the input text in characters (please note that this value is approximate for variable width fonts). 
    numEntriesPerColumn Integer 0  The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
    numRows Integer   The number of rows to show in a multi-select input. This attribute is invalid on a single-select input. 
    onPick Statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
    optionIcon Expression (String)   An optional expression to specify an icon for each option. The option value is exposed as "VALUE". The result must be a valid image file. 
    optionLabel Expression (String)   Optional Gosu expression used to determine the label displayed for each element of the value range. Defaults to the element's display name or string representation if not present. The element value is exposed as "VALUE". 
    requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
    required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
    setter Statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
    shortcut String   Optional keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. This is only applicable when this widget has an "action" specified and the value is not being edited. 
    showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
    shuttleList Boolean false  If true, the input will be rendered as a "shuttle" input, allowing the user to select options by moving them from one list to another. 
    sortValueRange Boolean true  If true, attempts to sort the results of valueRange 
    stacked Expression (Boolean)   If true, the radio buttons are stacked vertically. 
    subMenuOnDemand Boolean false  An optional attribute, if set, defer sub menu generation until user tries to open the menu. DO NOT set this flag unless the sub menu of this widget is very expensive to generate. Setting this flag will reduce time to load the page, however require fetching additional info from server in the background, when the menu gets opened for the first time after page loaded. 
    validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
    value Expression (context-dependent)   The value this Input binds to as an Expression. If the Input is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
    valueRange Expression (Object)   Gosu expression defining the range of possible values for this element. Should evaluate to a List, an array, or a IQueryBeanResult 
    valueType Type reference   The type of the value expression. 
    valueWidth Expression (java.lang.Integer)   Optional integer expression specifying the pixel width for the dropdown control inside the cell. Usually you get best results by leaving this unspecified. You can set this attribute when some options of this dropdown are too long and you need to reduce the display width of the dropdown control. 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   If used instead of "editable", specifies whether the Input is editable when data is being created 
    ReferencedIterator top
    Specifies the referenced iterator and optionally its flags.
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    flags String   The flags for the iterator 
    valueType Type reference   The valueType of the widget symbol, such as "String" or "Policy" 
    widget String   The name of widget 
    ReferencedRowTree top
    Specifies the referenced row tree.
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    widget String   The name of the row tree 
    ReferencedWidget top
    Specifies the widget needed by the containing section.
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    widget String   The name of the widget 
    ReflectCondition top
    Used to split the "value" of a Reflect element based on multiple conditions
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    condition Reflect expression   A boolean expression. The first ReflectCondition whose "condition" evaluates to true is used for its "value". If no ReflectConditions evaluate to true, then the reflector's value is unchanged (if you want it to revert to "null" you need to add a ReflectCondition at the end with condition="true" value="null") 
    value Reflect expression   The value to use if the condition evaluates to true, relatively to the trigger value, which will be exposed as "VALUE" if there is a single trigger or as "VALUE1", "VALUE2", etc. for multiple triggers. When there are multiple triggers, the index of the active trigger will be exposed as "TRIGGER_INDEX", for example, when the reflection is triggered by "VALUE1", "TRIGGER_INDEX" will be 1. 
    Reflect top
    Defines the client reflection properties of a single reflector. See the Reflection spec for more detail.
    Child elements: ReflectCondition
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    available Reflect expression   Boolean expression defining the availability of the reflector, relatively to the trigger value, which will be exposed as "VALUE" if there is a single trigger or as "VALUE1", "VALUE2", etc. for multiple triggers. When there are multiple triggers, the index of the active trigger will be exposed as "TRIGGER_INDEX", for example, when the reflection is triggered by "VALUE1", "TRIGGER_INDEX" will be 1. 
    custom Javascript expression   Custom JavaScript expression, normally relatively to the trigger value, which will be exposed as "VALUE" if there is a single trigger or as "VALUE1", "VALUE2", etc. for multiple triggers. When there are multiple triggers, the index of the active trigger will be exposed as "TRIGGER_INDEX", for example, when the reflection is triggered by "VALUE1", "TRIGGER_INDEX" will be 1. Theoretically, you can use this expression to do ANYTHING browser side. The expression will be invoked when the value of any of the reflection triggers changes. 
    inputMask Reflect expression   Gosu expression defining the reflector input mask, relatively to the trigger value, which will be exposed as "VALUE" if there is a single trigger or as "VALUE1", "VALUE2", etc. for multiple triggers. When there are multiple triggers, the index of the active trigger will be exposed as "TRIGGER_INDEX", for example, when the reflection is triggered by "VALUE1", "TRIGGER_INDEX" will be 1. 
    reflectDirectChangesOnly Boolean false  If true, this reflector only reflects direct changes on the trigger (i.e., ignores reflection propagation to indirect reflector). Default to false. 
    triggerIds String   Refers to the "id" attribute of the trigger, the value which when changed will alter the value of this element. Multiple ids can be separated by "," 
    value Reflect expression   Gosu expression defining the value of the reflector, relatively to the trigger value, which will be exposed as "VALUE" if there is a single trigger or as "VALUE1", "VALUE2", etc. for multiple triggers. When there are multiple triggers, the index of the active trigger will be exposed as "TRIGGER_INDEX", for example, when the reflection is triggered by "VALUE1", "TRIGGER_INDEX" will be 1. If you do not specify "value" and the value of the trigger is a proper substring of the value of the reflector, then value will be determined implicitly (i.e. if the trigger value is "Foo.Bar" and the reflector is "Foo.Bar.SomeField", the implicit reflection value is "VALUE.SomeField"). You can also use ReflectConditions instead of "value" 
    valueRange Reflect expression   Gosu expression defining the reflector value range,relatively to the trigger value, which will be exposed as "VALUE" if there is a single trigger or as "VALUE1", "VALUE2", etc. for multiple triggers. When there are multiple triggers, the index of the active trigger will be exposed as "TRIGGER_INDEX", for example, when the reflection is triggered by "VALUE1", "TRIGGER_INDEX" will be 1. 
    RemoveButton top
    A button to remove entries for the nearest iterator control after. This button is only visible when the associated iterator control defines "toRemove". If you want to add both "add" and "remove" button to the iterator, you can use instead.
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    confirmMessage Expression (String)   Confirmation message to show before performing the action 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    flags String   A very special expression defining what flags (see ToolbarFlag) must be checked for the toolbar button to be available (= not grayed out). All processing of flags happens on the browser-side. The flags syntax is a comma-separated list of predicates (with no space after each comma), and all predicates must be satisfied for the button to be available. Each predicate consists of a operator followed by a space and then the name of a ToolbarFlag. For instance, flags="one Foo,no Bar" means "only available if there is exactly one Foo checkbox checked and no Bar checkboxes checked". The available operators are: one, two, any, all, no, exists (same as any). 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    iterator Iterator reference   The id of the iterator/list view widget this button applies to. If the value is a list view then the first iterator widget child is used. 
    label Expression (Object)   label for this button 
    refreshTarget String   If specified, clicking the button will do a partial-page refresh rather than a full-page refresh. The semantics are the same as for the "target" attribute on a PostOnChange node: it can either be "DATA_ONLY" or the id of a valid target. 
    shortcut String   Keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
    showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean) true  Expression which determines whether or not the confirmation message should be shown 
    tooltip Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info if the user hovers the mouse over the button 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression specifying whether the remove button is visible. By default the remove button is visible when the Iterator has "toRemove" defined. 
    Require top
    Specifies that a symbol of a given name and type is required to exist in order to dynamically include the parent widget. During verification of the pages, this element actually defines the symbol with the given name and type and a null value (so that the contents of the widget can be verified). In this way the Require element acts much like a method argument.
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    name String   The name of the required symbol 
    type Type reference   The type of the required symbol, such as "String" or "Policy" 
    RowIterator top
    Creates as many copies of its Row content as there are components in the array referenced by "value". Supplies the component value to the created content as "elementName". Used inside a ListViewPanel or another RowIterator.
    Child elements: Variable ToolbarFilter ToolbarFlag IteratorSort AbstractRow
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    autoAdd Expression (Boolean)   An optional Boolean Gosu expression, if evaluated to true, add numEntriesToAdd elements to this iterator when entering the page, if the page is in edit mode upon enter. Normally not set, unless the iterator has less entries than required; otherwise, the user may have to manually remove unwanted entries that are automatically added. 
    canPick Expression (Boolean) true  Boolean expression which, if it evaluates to false, hides the select button (but not the column). Only applies if pickValue is defined. 
    cellNavOnEnter Boolean false  If true, ENTER key will navigate thru editable cells in this row iterator. Default to false, in which case the user can navigate thru the cells using ALT+SHIFT+<arrow-key>. 
    checkBoxVisible Expression (Boolean)   A Gosu expression (evaluates to a boolean) which designates whether or not the checkboxes are visible. Does nothing if hasCheckBoxes is false. 
    conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   An optional Gosu expression used to convert a picked value into a value that can be added to the iterator. The picked value is available as the special symbol "PickedValue" 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    editable Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether any of the columns can be editable. It is an error to make any Cell editable if this attribute is false; conversely, it is an error to use this RowIterator over a IQueryBeanResult if the attribute is true 
    elementName String   As each element in the array result of "value" is displayed, it is exposed as a symbol with the name "elementName", which the contents of this iterator can refer to 
    forceRefreshDespiteChangedEntries Boolean false  If true, the iterator will refresh its entries even if they have changed.

    This has risks. Refreshing from an IQueryBeanResult value will ignore newly added or removed entries. Changed or newly added entries may be reordered or moved out of the currently visible page, possibly bypassing UI validation. User input that cannot be written to the underlying data (such as malformed date strings) may be lost.

    Use with care. Safest on list or array iterators that don't have paging or contain only simple inputs such as checkboxes or dropdowns

     
    hasCheckBoxes Boolean false  If true, generates a checkbox on the left of each content row. Default is false unless the "toRemove" attribute is specified. This attribute only applies to the content rows directly under this iterator, and not to rows embedded under a child iterator or RowSetRef. 
    height String -1  Do not use, set the height at parent ListView level instead. 
    hideCheckBoxesIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, then generated checkboxes will be invisible when the listview is read-only. Does nothing if hasCheckboxes=false. Defaults to false 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    numEntriesRequired Integer 0  Number of entries that must be filled out to pass validation on this page 
    numEntriesToAdd Integer 1  An optional attribute, if set, overrides number of entries to add when the add button is pushed. Default to 1. Normally not set.

    If set to a value greater than 1, any entry that is not modified by the user after it's added will be removed before commit the page. It's a risk of potential data loss. USE WITH CAUTION.

     
    pageSize Integer   The number of elements in a single page, or 0 to disable paging. The default value is specified in ListViewPageSizeDefault parameter in config.xml 
    pickLocation Statement   Specifies the picker popup to use when adding new elements to the iterator, as a Gosu statement of the format "[popup name].push(...)" 
    pickValue Expression (context-dependent)   Gosu expression specifying what value a row will select. If specified, then adds a "SELECT" button to the left of each content row. 
    pickWidth Integer 80  The width of the pick column cell if specified. 
    quickAddOnEnter Boolean false  If true, ENTER key will navigate you thru editable cells, and add a new entry when you are at the last editable cell of this row iterator. Adding a new entry via ENTER key does not submit or validate previously entered data. Default to false. This is an experimental attribute only applicable to very basic ListView configuration and for users who do not have full keyboard access. Do not set this property in other cases. 
    selectLabel Expression (String) DisplayKey.get("Button.Select")  Overrides the text on the "SELECT" button. Only applies if pickValue is defined. 
    startChecked Expression (Boolean)   A Gosu expression which, if true, means the checkbox will start as checked 
    toAdd Statement   The Gosu expression that is evaluated to add a new value to the list. The value is exposed using the name specified by "elementName". An example would be "Foo.addToBars(bar)". Either toAdd or toCreateAndAdd must be defined for the user to add entries to the iterator; however you cannot define both. If the entries are not entities, toCreateAndAdd must be used instead of toAdd. 
    toCreateAndAdd Expression (context-dependent)   The Gosu expression that is evaluated to create a new value and add it to the list. An example would be "Foo.addToBars(Foo.createNewBar())". Either toAdd or toCreateAndAdd must be defined for the user to add entries to the iterator; however you cannot define both. 
    toRemove Statement   The Gosu expression that is evaluated to remove a value from the Iterator. The value is exposed using the name specified by "elementName". Must be defined for the user to be able to remove values from the iterator. 
    type Type reference   Lets you manually specify the type of element exposed as "elementName". This is useful if you have special knowledge about the type of element returned by "value": for example, if the field referred to returns an array of Contacts but you happen to know that they are guaranteed to all be Persons 
    validationLabel Expression (String)   Validation label for errors associated with the RowIterator as a whole 
    value Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression that evaluates to the elements over which to iterate. Must evaluate to an Object array or a IQueryBeanResult. 
    valueType Type reference   The type of the value expression. 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
    Row top
    A row used inside a ListViewPanel. May contain multiple cells.
    Child elements: AbstractCell
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    editable Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, makes all the child cells in this row read-only. This is a convenient alternative for setting the "editable" attribute on each child cell. This attribute can be used to prevent modifying the cell data directly on the UI; however, it does not prevent modifying the underlying data indirectly (for example, through a Toolbar button). 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    highlighted Expression (Boolean)   If true, the row will be highlighted. 
    id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    refreshOnProgressComplete Expression (Object)   Only meaningful when this widget contains a Progress widget. Specifies an entity to refresh when the Progress widget completes its operation, at which point this widget will re-render itself. 
    renderAsSmartHeader Boolean false  If true, renders this row as a smart header. Default to false. 
    useArchivedStyle Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, all child widgets of the row will be rendered in "archived" style 
    useSubHeaderStyle Expression (Boolean)   If true, renders this row in sub-header style. Default to false. 
    useTitleStyle Expression (Boolean)   If true, renders this row in title style. Default to false. Do not use in normally formatted ListViews. 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
    RowSet top
    A reusable set of rows that can be included by reference.
    Child elements: Require Variable Expose ExposeIterator ExposeRowTree ReferencedWidget AbstractRow
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    mode String   An optional String which, if specified, means that any element dynamically including this widget must specify the same mode. There is also a special mode "default" you can use which means "Use this widget if no widget with the specified mode exists". You can also have this widget match more than one mode by separating mode strings with a | character. 
    RowSetRef top
    Includes a RowSet by reference.
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    def Shared section reference   The ID of the RowSet to include by reference. 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    mode Expression (Object)   If defined, "mode" is evaluated and its result is converted to a String; the panel will be loaded whose "mode" matches the evaluated "mode" of this element. If no panel is found with a matching "mode", then the panel with mode="default" is used; if there is no default a runtime exception is thrown 
    widgets Widget ids   A comma separated list of widgets that are needed by the section. 
    RowTree top
    Creates an expandable tree based on its Row child, as defined by the elements in the array referenced by "value". Supplies the component value to the created content as "elementName". Used inside a ListViewPanel.
    Child elements: Variable ToolbarFilter ToolbarFlag IteratorSort Row
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    canPick Expression (Boolean) true  Boolean expression which, if it evaluates to false, hides the select button (but not the column). Only applies if pickValue is defined. 
    checkBoxVisible Expression (Boolean)   A Gosu expression (evaluates to a boolean) which designates whether or not the checkboxes are visible. Does nothing if hasCheckBoxes is false. 
    containerAction Statement   A Gosu expression evaluating to the action on the label displayed for a parent row in the tree. Only applicable if containerType is specified. 
    containerLabel Expression (String)   A Gosu expression evaluating to the label displayed for a parent row in the tree. Only required if containerType is specified. 
    containerLabelColspan Integer 1  EXPERIMENTAL, DO NOT USE!!! If the number is greater than 1, no more cells will be rendered to the right of the containerLabel cell. 
    containerType Type reference   The type of element represented by parent nodes in the tree, if they are of a different type than the leaf nodes. 
    contentType Type reference   The type of element represented by leaf nodes in the tree. All Cells after the first will only be populated for elements of this type. (Note that non-leaf nodes of this type will also have their cells populated.) 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    elementName String   As each element in the array result of "value" is displayed, it is exposed as a symbol with the name "elementName", which the contents of this iterator can refer to 
    hasCheckBoxes Boolean false  If true, generates a checkbox on the left of each content row. Default is false unless the "toRemove" attribute is specified. This attribute only applies to the content rows directly under this iterator, and not to rows embedded under a child iterator or RowSetRef. 
    height String -1  Do not use, set the height at parent ListView level instead. 
    hideCheckBoxesIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, then generated checkboxes will be invisible when the listview is read-only. Does nothing if hasCheckboxes=false. Defaults to false 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    pageSize Integer 0  The number of elements in a single page. ** Note: pageSize is not supported for RowTree. Default is set to 0 to disable paging. 
    pickValue Expression (context-dependent)   Gosu expression specifying what value a row will select. If specified, then adds a "SELECT" button to the left of each content row. 
    selectLabel Expression (String)   Overrides the text on the "SELECT" button. Only applies if pickValue is defined. 
    startChecked Expression (Boolean)   A Gosu expression which, if true, means the checkbox will start as checked 
    value Expression (gw.api.tree.TreeNode)   A Gosu expression that evaluates to the top-level elements from which to create the tree. Must evaluate to an object implementing gw.api.tree.TreeNode. 
    Scope top
    Specifies a scope where this worksheet is allowed to show.
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    location Location reference   The location which, when used as the top location in the main frame, allows this worksheet to be visible. Format: "[location name]([args])", or "*" for any location. 
    Screen top
    The top GUI widget for the visible content of a page.
    Child elements: Require Variable TitleBar Toolbar Verbatim Messages AlertBar AbstractPanel AbstractPanelDef Calendar Code
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    editable Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
    id String   ID of this Screen. It must end with "Screen". It has to be unique if this Screen is defined in a separate file (i.e. referenceable by a ScreenRef). 
    mode String   An optional String which, if specified, means that any element dynamically including this widget must specify the same mode. There is also a special mode "default" you can use which means "Use this widget if no widget with the specified mode exists". You can also have this widget match more than one mode by separating mode strings with a | character. 
    ScreenRef top
    Includes a Screen by reference
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    def Shared section reference   ID of the screen to include by reference 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    mode Expression (Object)   If defined, "mode" is evaluated and its result is converted to a String; the screen will be loaded whose "mode" matches the evaluated "mode" of this element. If no screen is found with a matching "mode", then the panel with mode="default" is used; if there is no default a runtime exception is thrown 
    SearchItem top
    A search item under the tab menu.
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    afterFailure Statement   Optional expression which performs some action after navigating to the search page after a failure (typically modifying the search criteria). The search criteria are exposed as searchCriteria, and the user's input as searchText. 
    clearSearchText Boolean true  If true, the search text is cleared after performing the search. 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    inputMask Expression (String)   An optional gosu expression that returns a string to use as the input mask. This field should only be necessary in cases where the data type has no mask or where the mask needs to be conditional. The input mask returned should be of the same format as a mask specified using the input-mask attribute on a field validator (use # for wildcards). The default placeholder specified by the InputMaskPlaceholderCharacter parameter will be used as the placeholder character during rendering. 
    label Expression (String)   Gosu expression for the label of the item 
    onFailure Expression (pcf.api.Location)   Expression which navigates to the appropriate search page if the search fails. The user's input is exposed as searchText. 
    onResult Statement   Expression which navigates to the appropriate location when a single result is successfully returned. The result is exposed as a symbol called "result". 
    property Expression (gw.lang.reflect.IPropertyInfo)   An entity property whose field validator is to generate the input mask on the search box. 
    search Expression (Object)   Expression which performs the search, taking the user's input as searchText and returning a single result, or null on failure. 
    validationError Expression (String)   Expression which returns the error to display on a failed search. The user's input is exposed as searchText. 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
    SearchPanel top
    A special panel to facilitate performing searches. The Search Panel typically contains a DetailView to enter search criteria and a ListView to display search result. The search criteria entry DetailView is always editable, no matther if the enclosing context is being edited or not.
    Child elements: AbstractPanel AbstractPanelDef Code
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    cachingEnabled Expression (Boolean) true  If false, disables all caching of the criteria and results of this Searcher. Defaults to true. 
    clearInvisibleInputs Boolean false  If true, clears invisible Inputs with values that are left over from a previous state of the screen. Limitation: If a field appears twice on the screen, once visible and once invisible, both inputs will be cleared. 
    criteriaName String   The name by which the search criteria will be exposed as a symbol. Typically the criteria are edited by a DetailView. 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    maxSearchResults Expression (Object)   If specified, sets the maximum number of search results that can be returned by this search. If more than this number of results are returned, an error message will be displayed instead telling the user to refine their search. Values of 0 or less are ignored - that is no maximum will be imposed 
    resultCachingEnabled Boolean true  If false, disables caching of search *results* (while leaving caching of criteria). Defaults to true. Moot if cachingEnabled is false. 
    resultsName String   The name by which the search results (normally a List, Array, or IQueryBeanResult) will be exposed as a symbol. Typically the results are shown in a ListView. 
    search Expression (Object)   Gosu expression that does the actual search. 
    searchCriteria Expression (context-dependent)   Gosu expression that creates the search criteria. The return type must be serializable. 
    searchCriteriaType Type reference   The type of the search criteria, which must be serializable 
    searchOnEnter Expression (Boolean)   An optional Gosu expression, if true, and if there are no search results cached from last visit to this page, the SearchPanel will run a search as soon as the user enters the page 
    searchOnRefresh Boolean true  If true, the SearchPanel will re-run the last query when the page is refreshed. Only applicable when the search results type is a Query. 
    searchResultsType Type reference   The type of the search expression. 
    SingleFileInput top
    SkipButton top
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    destination String   The ID of the step to go to 
    label Expression (String)   Gosu expression for the label to display on this button 
    shortcut String   Keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
    visible Expression (Boolean) true  Gosu expression that indicates whether this button should appear on the screen. Tree.If not specified, the button will always appear 
    StandardMenuElement top
    Subclasses: AbstractAddMenuItem MenuItemDivider MenuItemIterator MenuItem MenuItemSetRef MenuItemTree PickerMenuItem SearchItem
    SystemAlertBarElement top
    A single element in SystemAlertBarBar.
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    action Statement   Action performed by this widget. By default, this is a Gosu expression. 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
    styleClass WidgetStyleClass   CSS style class for the link; for instance, "miniButton" makes the link appear as a small button 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget. 
    SystemAlertBar top
    An area below TabBar for displaying system alert information
    Child elements: Require Variable SystemAlertBarElement
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    icon Expression (String)   Refers to an image file. If defined, this image is used as the icon displayed to the left of the system alert bar. 
    id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
    TabBarLink top
    A hyperlink in the right area of the TabBar
    Child elements: StandardMenuElement
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    action Statement   Action performed by this widget. By default, this is a Gosu expression. Other types of actions can be specified by using the following prefixes: http: causes the browser to follow the specified plain http link https: causes the browser to follow the specified plain https link javascript: causes the browser to execute the specified javascript logout: logs out of the application 
    available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children and makes them unclickable 
    confirmMessage Expression (String)   Confirmation message to show before performing the action 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    download Download   Should be 'true', 'inline' or 'attachment' if the action taken by this widget is to download a file. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
    promptDefault Expression (String)   Default text answer to the prompt message 
    promptQuestion Expression (String)   Question to ask the user before performing the action. The answser is exposed to the action as "web.WebUtil.ActionEventParameter". 
    shortcut String   Keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
    showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean) true  Gosu expression which determines whether or not the confirmation message should be shown 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
    TabBarLogout top
    A special Logout link in the right area of the TabBar
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    action Statement   Action performed by this widget. By default, this is a Gosu expression. Other types of actions can be specified by using the following prefixes: http: causes the browser to follow the specified plain http link https: causes the browser to follow the specified plain https link javascript: causes the browser to execute the specified javascript logout: logs out of the application 
    available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children and makes them unclickable 
    confirmMessage Expression (String)   Confirmation message to show before performing the action 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    download Download   Should be 'true', 'inline' or 'attachment' if the action taken by this widget is to download a file. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
    promptDefault Expression (String)   Default text answer to the prompt message 
    promptQuestion Expression (String)   Question to ask the user before performing the action. The answser is exposed to the action as "web.WebUtil.ActionEventParameter". 
    shortcut String   Keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
    showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean) true  Gosu expression which determines whether or not the confirmation message should be shown 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
    TabBar top
    The set of tabs at the top of the browser window
    Child elements: Variable TabBarUnsavedWork Tab TabBarLink TabBarLogout HiddenLink
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    hideQuickJump Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if true, hides QuickJump widget in the tab bar. 
    id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    systemAlertBar Shared section reference   System alert bar, used to display system wide alert messages 
    TabBarUnsavedWork top
    Tab bar link leads to unsaved work
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    id String   id of the widget. Must be unique among the siblings 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
    Tab top
    A single Tab in the TabBar
    Child elements: StandardMenuElement
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    action Statement   Action performed by this widget. By default, this is a Gosu expression. Other types of actions can be specified by using the following prefixes: http: causes the browser to follow the specified plain http link https: causes the browser to follow the specified plain https link javascript: causes the browser to execute the specified javascript logout: logs out of the application 
    available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children and makes them unclickable 
    confirmMessage Expression (String)   Confirmation message to show before performing the action 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    download Download   Should be 'true', 'inline' or 'attachment' if the action taken by this widget is to download a file. 
    flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
    hideIfDisabled Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression. If returns true, this widget will not be displayed when the action is disabled. Default to true. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
    numEntriesPerColumn Integer 0  The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
    promptDefault Expression (String)   Default text answer to the prompt message 
    promptQuestion Expression (String)   Question to ask the user before performing the action. The answser is exposed to the action as "web.WebUtil.ActionEventParameter". 
    shortcut String   Keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
    showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean) true  Gosu expression which determines whether or not the confirmation message should be shown 
    subMenuOnDemand Boolean false  An optional attribute, if set, defer sub menu generation until user tries to open the menu. DO NOT set this flag unless the sub menu of this widget is very expensive to generate. Setting this flag will reduce time to load the page, however require fetching additional info from server in the background, when the menu gets opened for the first time after page loaded. 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
    TemplatePanelContents top
    A wrapper element that contains the contents of a TemplatePanel. The content are rendered inside an enclosing HTML page, therefore they should not start with "...".
    No attributes
    TemplatePanel top
    A panel that renders readonly content based on a Gosu block. This element is typically used to aggregate external content inside a Guidewire page. The content of this Panel is rendered inside an enclosing HTML page, therefore it should not start with "...".
    Child elements: ReferencedWidget TemplatePanelContents
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    renderCall Statement   A method call to write output to the provided write object. Generally, this takes the form of a callout to render a Gosu template, i.e. MyTemplate.render(__writer, other args). This attribute has access to a symbol named __writer of type java.io.Writer as well as String arguments for each of the ReferencedWidgets for this panel (however, the panel does not have access to properties or functions defined in Code blocks in the same PCF document).
